description.hltext_display: Sri Lankan President says mechanism in place to address false allegations leveled against the country
description.content:
* Dec 21, Diyathalawa: Sri Lanka President Mahinda Rajapaksa said today that a mechanism has been put in place at international level to handle the false allegations leveled against the country.
Addressing an Army passing out parade of the Sri Lanka Military Academy at Diyathalawa on Tuesday, the Commander-In-Chief said that many false allegations have been leveled against Sri Lanka of committing war crimes. The President in his address to 253 Cadet Officers who passed out from the Academy told the new officers that foreign states are still trying to resurrect the defeated terrorist elements by accusing the country of alleged war crimes and to tarnish country's image.
The fight against such elements has already been launched and pursued at international levels, the President pointed out.
President Rajapaksa has added even though the war has come to an end, the government was continuing with the humanitarian operations in the form of development programmes in the country.
"The humanitarian operation that got underway in 2006 is still not over. It was not at all a war. Had we pursued a war, it would have ended soon after the decimation of the terrorist leader," he said.
The President said the continuing humanitarian operation has now entered a special phase and the Security Forces are working tirelessly to win the hearts and minds of the people suffered due to the war.
President Rajapaksa advised the new officers to learn Tamil language as well as other languages with a broader insight into the culture and heritage and serve the country.
Secretary to the President Lalith Weerathunge, Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa, Commander of the Army Lieutenant General Jagath Jayasuriya, Commanding officer Sri Lanka Air Force-Diyathalawa Group Captain Lanka Kodippili, senior officers, and families of the graduates were present at the occasion.
(Photos by Chandana Perera)
ColomboPage - Recent 10 Stories

description.hltext_display: Protests rise against winter schools as Kashmir Valley shivers
description.content: The relentless cold wave and sub-zero temperatures have left thousands of students in the Kashmir Valley literally shivering in their classrooms, with protests rising against the government's decision to keep schools open during the winter. The minimum temperature plunged to minus 5.4 degree Celsius in Srinagar Wednesday and the meteorological department has warned that it could fall further in the coming days.Schools have been ordered to start winter classes this year in order to make up for the lost working days. The unrest in the Valley that began June 11 had forced them to close down for over four months.Over 2.5 lakh students in classes 9-12, who have been asked to continue classes, now find themselves forced to face the harsh cold.Students from at least three private schools assembled at the Press Enclave in Srinagar Tuesday to protest the lack of adequate heating arrangements inside their classrooms.Ruling National Conference (NC) provincial president Ali Muhammad Dar Wednesday appealed to Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to reconsider the decision.We appeal the chief minister to look into the issue personally as the students are suffering, Dar said. A local lawyer has also filed a public suit urging the high court to ask the government to provide necessary heating facilities to the students in schools or revoke the decision to keep them open in winter.Government has made it mandatory for winter schools in the Valley to make adequate heating facilties, an education department official said.He said the department would carry out surprise inspections of schools to ensure that heating arrangements are sufficient.The news from the weather office is not very good either, at least for the coming few days. The clear night skies are likely to further bring the temperatures down.The minimum temperature was minus 5.4 degrees Celsius in Srinagar Wednesday. It was minus 9.6 in Leh and minus 10.6 in Kargil towns," M.S. Wani, assistant meteorologist, said.In Pahalgam it was minus 5.6 while Gulmarg was at minus 5 Wednesday.Wani said the present weather conditions would continue for a few more days.Most of the snow and rain in the Valley during the winter months owes itself to western disturbances - the Caspian Sea storms derived from the Westerlies - that enter the region from the Afghanistan-Pakistan side.As of now, we do not have any such build-up in our vicinity, which means temperatures could fall further in the coming days, the official said.The minimum temperature plunged to minus 5.4 degree Celsius in Srinagar Wednesday and the meteorological department has warned that it could fall further in the coming days.Schools have been ordered to start winter classes this year in order to make up for the lost working days. The unrest in the Valley that began June 11 had forced them to close down for over four months.Over 2.5 lakh students in classes 9-12, who have been asked to continue classes, now find themselves forced to face the harsh cold.Students from at least three private schools assembled at the Press Enclave in Srinagar Tuesday to protest the lack of adequate heating arrangements inside their classrooms.Ruling National Conference (NC) provincial president Ali Muhammad Dar Wednesday appealed to Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to reconsider the decision.We appeal the chief minister to look into the issue personally as the students are suffering, Dar said. A local lawyer has also filed a public suit urging the high court to ask the government to provide necessary heating facilities to the students in schools or revoke the decision to keep them open in winter.Government has made it mandatory for winter schools in the Valley to make adequate heating facilties, an education department official said.He said the department would carry out surprise inspections of schools to ensure that heating arrangements are sufficient.The news from the weather office is not very good either, at least for the coming few days. The clear night skies are likely to further bring the temperatures down.The minimum temperature was minus 5.4 degrees Celsius in Srinagar Wednesday. It was minus 9.6 in Leh and minus 10.6 in Kargil towns," M.S. Wani, assistant meteorologist, said.In Pahalgam it was minus 5.6 while Gulmarg was at minus 5 Wednesday.Wani said the present weather conditions would continue for a few more days.Most of the snow and rain in the Valley during the winter months owes itself to western disturbances - the Caspian Sea storms derived from the Westerlies - that enter the region from the Afghanistan-Pakistan side.As of now, we do not have any such build-up in our vicinity, which means temperatures could fall further in the coming days, the official said.

description.hltext_display: VÃ¤ndning fÃ¶r massapriset
Pak can't progress unless intelligence agencies work within law: Chaudhry Nisar
description.content:
Pakistan cannot progress unless its intelligence agencies are circled within laws and the Constitution, the opposition leader in the National Assembly, Chaudhry Nisar Ali Khan, has said.
Speaking on the floor of the House, Nisar said that in the past, governments had been destabilised by the agencies, and therefore, they must be put under law and Constitution.
Without mentioning the Reformed General Sales Tax (RGST) bill, Nisar said that the government was about to introduce yet another important law in the parliament without taking into confidence the opposition and even its allies, adding that if the opposition had some difference on a bill, it had a right to speak against it.
"Difference of opinion is our right and nobody should oppose this," the Daily Times quoted him, as saying.
Nisar deplored the statement of the United States Ambassador on the implementation of the RGST, saying that the government should take notice of it, and take measures to stop foreigners from indulging in the internal matters of the country.
He also deplored the statement of the US chairman of Joint Staff regarding an operation in North Waziristan, saying that the parliament had a right to take any decision in this regard.
Commenting on the Hajj scandal, the opposition leader said that the incident had defamed Pakistan, as not a single incident of corruption in Hajj matters had been reported in other countries. (ANI)

description.hltext_display: Blue Collar Vs. White Collar Crimes
description.content: Have you ever heard the phrase "white collar crime"? No, not just the popular television show airing on the USA network, but the real criminal offense category termed thusly due to the class of people who normally commit the crime. There is a big difference between blue collar and white collar crimes in the United States, from the crime classifications to the punishments thereof.Generally speaking, the traditional attire of the person committing that style of crime defines the crime's classification. White collar refers to the dress shirts worn by these types of office workers wear, with white collars and ties. Blue collar would refer to the standard uniforms worn by many working class individuals. These are very general terms, and there is no law that states that a working class person cannot commit a white collar crime and vice versa. The classifications refer more to the crime itself as a general definition than the actual perpetrators.Â Also, these are generalized classifications coined by the media and are not codified as crimes in the classic sense in our judicial system.Definition of Blue Collar CrimesA blue collar crime is a highly visible crime committed by the average working class or poor American, from violent crimes to thievery and even drug-related crimes. Most are perpetrated by people who believe that they have nothing to lose, and everything to gain, by the success or failure of the crime, and the crime is committed due to a lack of hope, environmental pressures, peer pressure, or a simple feeling that there are no other options.Blue collar crimes are typically associated with Americans who work for a living, heading to day jobs or night shifts in order to earn an income and support a family the hard way. According to experts, the unemployed are at highest risk for committing what is classified as a blue collar crime. Crimes in this category typically include theft, drug charges, DUIs, and violent crimes.Â Keep in mind that many high-powered executives get charged with DUIs, crimes of violence and drug crimes.Â The difference is that they aren't charged with these type of crimes at the same high rate as blue collar workers.White Collar CrimesOpposite of blue collar crimes, white collar criminals are typically the high class people who inherited money or earn a lot of money at upper level jobs, such as management, business or corporate bigwigs, et cetera. The types of crimes committed are generally technical or money-related in nature, such as computer-based crimes or embezzlement, and these crimes are steadily increasing as more people discover the negative aspects of doing business primarily online.There are many different sophisticated crimes that are classified as white collar crimes according to legal precedent. They include, but are not limited to: embezzlement, money laundering, identity theft, credit card fraud, hacking, forgery, and similar crimes. The punishments for the white collar crimes are drastically different as well, often incurring probation or community service in conjunction with high monetary fines instead of focusing solely on incarceration, as is the case with many blue collar crimes.Â However, with the Bernie Madoff scandal as well as the other recent wall street crimes, more and more white collar criminals are facing stiff criminal penalties that include long periods of incarceration in federal prisons.Â This is due in large part to the severe societal and economic impact of these crimes as well and the attention brought to these crimes by the media.This information is provided solely for informational purposes and does not constitute legal advice.

description.hltext_display: NDA demands PM's resignation over 2G scam
description.content: The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) Wednesday sought Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's resignation ''on moral grounds'' if the government fails to answer opposition concerns on the alleged irregularities in the 2G spectrum allocation. "If you are saying the Prime Minister's post should be above suspicion, then you should honestly form a JPC (joint parliamentary committee) to probe the 2G scam. And if you don't have answers to opposition concerns, then the prime minister should quit his post on moral grounds," Arun Jaitley of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which leads the NDA, said while addressing an anti-government rally here.At the Congress plenary Monday, Manmohan Singh had again rejected the BJPs demand to set up a JPC to investigate the 2G scam. He expressed his readiness to appear before parliaments Public Accounts Committee but said the prime minister's post should be above suspicion. The opposition has turned down the offer. The BJP and its partners in the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) took its fight against corruption to Delhi's streets two days after the Congress plenary concluded. All major leaders of the NDA constituents are attending the rally at the Ram Lila grounds. The anti-United Progressive Alliance (UPA) rally comes after the opposition parties stalled parliament for the entire Nov 9-Dec 13 winter session demanding a JPC probe into the wrongdoings in the allocating second generation telephony spectrum in 2008, an issue that forced DMK leader A.Raja to quit as communications minister.The rally, targetting the Congress-led UPA on various corruption scams, kick-starts the NDAs two-month long nationwide campaign against corruption."If you are saying the Prime Minister's post should be above suspicion, then you should honestly form a JPC (joint parliamentary committee) to probe the 2G scam. And if you don't have answers to opposition concerns, then the prime minister should quit his post on moral grounds," Arun Jaitley of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), which leads the NDA, said while addressing an anti-government rally here.At the Congress plenary Monday, Manmohan Singh had again rejected the BJPs demand to set up a JPC to investigate the 2G scam. He expressed his readiness to appear before parliaments Public Accounts Committee but said the prime minister's post should be above suspicion. The opposition has turned down the offer. The BJP and its partners in the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) took its fight against corruption to Delhi's streets two days after the Congress plenary concluded. All major leaders of the NDA constituents are attending the rally at the Ram Lila grounds. The anti-United Progressive Alliance (UPA) rally comes after the opposition parties stalled parliament for the entire Nov 9-Dec 13 winter session demanding a JPC probe into the wrongdoings in the allocating second generation telephony spectrum in 2008, an issue that forced DMK leader A.Raja to quit as communications minister.The rally, targetting the Congress-led UPA on various corruption scams, kick-starts the NDAs two-month long nationwide campaign against corruption.

description.hltext_display: Ernst & Young in Lehman lawsuit
description.content:
Lord Hutton's review of the future of the public sector pension schemes has been urged to recommend that they be changed to career average schemes. Read more
Costain bid rejected by Mouchel
22-Dec
Engineering group Costain confirms that it has had a takeover proposal rejected by outsourcing company Mouchel. Read more
Japan's export growth accelerates
22-Dec
Japanese export growth expands for the first time in nine months in November but the government forecasts slower economic growth Read more
Emerging nations upbeat on 2011
22-Dec
A survey of economic prospects for 2011 suggests emerging economies are more optimistic than the richer G7 nations. Read more 22-Dec
Accountancy giant Ernst & Young is sued by New York's attorney general over its role in the collapse of Lehman Brothers. Read more
Concern over supermarkets' growth
22-Dec
Concerns are raised about the growth of the 'big four' supermarkets after BBC research finds at least 577 new stores were approved in the UK in two years. Read more
Two fight over growth town sites
22-Dec
Two supermarkets fight for new sites in a Northamptonshire town which is expected to grow over the next decade. Read more
Vince Cable will stay in cabinet
21-Dec
Vince Cable told undercover reporters he planned to block Rupert Murdoch's efforts to take full control of BSkyB, according to the BBC's Robert Peston. Read more

description.hltext_display: 500 CV per l'Audi RS5 Senner Touning
description.content:
In Casa Audi hanno pensato che 450 CV non bastavano e cosÃ¬ hanno rilanciato : lâAudi RS5 Senner Touning arriva ad erogarne fino a 500. La RS5 Ã¨ stata presentata pochi giorni fa e rappoaresenta una delle ultime evoluzioni fatte dal preparatore Senner, il quale aveva giÃ elaborato vetture come la Volkswagen Golf R32 Carbon Racer, lâAudi A1 e la S5 Sportback.

description.hltext_display: Rappers tell of pinch of luck with Assange
description.content: Julian Assange makes a cameo appearance on . Source: Supplied Julian Assange showed his sense of humour with a cameo on , its creators say. Source: Supplied Rap News creators tell of experience Assange "a preternaturally calm person" Still keep in touch with "occasional message" THE creators of Australian internet hit Rap News say they are still "pinching themselves" after controversial and reclusive WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange appeared in a cameo role.

description.hltext_display: Austerity: 2010's most searched for term
description.content:
'Austerity' was the most-searched for term in 2010, and has been named Merriam-Webster's Word of the Year.
Also making the top ten list was the word 'doppelganger'. Other words include 'moratorium,' 'socialism' and 'bigot', reports the Daily Mail.
John Morse, president of the Massachusetts-based dictionary, said the search for the word's definition has been parallel to news coverage of the worldwide financial crisis that has seen protests and riots in Greece, Spain and Britain.
"What we look for (is) what are the words that have had spikes that strike us very much as an anomaly for their regular behaviour," said Morse.
"The word that really qualifies this year for that is "austerity"," he said.
Editors at the company believe that 'socialism' was searched because of coverage around financial bailouts and Democratic-backed health care legislation in the U.S.
They also noted that 'pragmatic' was looked-up a number of times after U.S. midterm elections.
Peter Sokolowski, Merriam-Webster's editor-at-large, said 'doppelganger' saw a jump in searches after George Stephanopoulos of U.S TV show Good Morning America called Elizabeth Gilbert - author of Eat, Pray, Love - 'Julia Roberts' doppelganger'.
'Bigot' was used by then prime minister Gordon Brown about a Labour voter in Rochdale during the General Election campaign.
Allan Metcalf, an English professor at MacMurray College in Jacksonville, Illinois said the list of words shows how the country is evolving.
"Around 20 to 30 years ago, everyone would know what "socialism" was. Same with "bigot". That fact that they have to be looked up says something about us" he said.
Similarly, although searches for the word 'shellacking' went up after President Barack Obama said he and his party took 'a shellacking' from voters in midterm election, Jenna Portier, an English instructor at Nicholls State University in Thibodaux, Louisiana, said the word is very common in southern Louisiana. (ANI)

description.hltext_display: [$] Ohio Senate rejects late-term appointments by Strickland
Governor declares state of emergency for Kern, five other counties
description.content:
Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger
Updated: 12/21 7:17 pm
The following is a news release from the governor's press office:
PROCLAMATION OF A STATE OF EMERGENCY
WHEREAS on December 18, 2010, a series of severe rainstorms began to sweep across California, bringing high winds and significant amounts of precipitation; and
WHEREAS these severe storms are causing harm to people and property, flooding homes and infrastructure, damaging public and private facilities, closing roads and highways, and requiring emergency response and debris clean-up; and
WHEREAS flood conditions caused by these storms are causing the evacuation of residents and the opening of emergency shelters; and
WHEREAS the weather forecast is for extraordinary and continuing rainfall, which will pose a continued threat of flooding in urban areas and small streams and rock slides and debris flow in the recent wildfire areas, damage to flood control systems, slope failure, erosion, and in coastal regions the potential for harbor damage and tidal surge; and
WHEREAS on December 18, 2010, Orange County proclaimed a local emergency; and
WHEREAS on December 19, 2010, Kern County proclaimed a local emergency and reiterated this proclamation on December 21, 2010; and
WHEREAS on December 20, 2010, Tulare County proclaimed a local emergency; and
WHEREAS on December 21, 2010, the counties of Riverside and San Luis Obispo proclaimed local emergencies; and
WHEREAS San Bernardino County is expected to declare a local emergency; and
WHEREAS the circumstances of these storms, by reason of their magnitude, are or are likely to be beyond the control of the services, personnel, equipment and facilities of any single county, city and county, or city and require the combined forces of a mutual aid region or regions to combat; and
WHEREAS under the provisions of section 8558(b) of the California Government Code, I find that conditions of extreme peril to the safety of persons and property exist due to the storm conditions in the counties of Kern, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino, San Luis Obispo and Tulare.
NOW, THEREFORE, I, ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGER, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the state Constitution and statutes, including the California Emergency Services Act, and in particular, section 8625 of the California Government Code, HEREBY PROCLAIM A STATE OF EMERGENCY to exist within Kern, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino, San Luis Obispo, and Tulare counties.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that all agencies of the state government utilize and employ state personnel, equipment and facilities for the performance of any and all activities consistent with the direction of my California Emergency Management Agency (Cal EMA) and the State Emergency Plan, and that Cal EMA provide local government assistance under the authority of the California Disaster Assistance Act.
I FURTHER DIRECT that as soon as hereafter possible, this proclamation be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this proclamation.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State of California to be affixed this 21st day of December 2010.
_____________________________
ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGER
Governor of California

description.hltext_display: Latin American Adventures Animate Memoir of a Wannabe Latina, Published by Outskirts Press
description.author: Outskirts Press, Inc
description.content: --(PR.com)-- Outskirts Press, Inc. has published Memoir of a Wannabe Latina: A Latin American Love Song For My Sons by Anne Kirchheimer. The author's most recent book to date is a 7 x 10 paperback in the autobiography and personal memoirs category and is available worldwide on book retailer websites such as Amazon and Barnes & Noble. The webpage at www.outskirtspress.com/wannabelatina was launched simultaneously with the book's publication.Memoir of a Wannabe Latina is a fast paced, illuminating book that delves into author Anne Kirchheimers adventures in Latin America while offering a snapshot history of the Americas.Opting to study Spanish as a high school student decades ago impacted the authors entire life -- her studies, jobs, travel, friends, loves and her children. Ms Kirchheimer wrote the memoir for her two Brazilian-born sons, Joe and Kenny, who affectionately dubbed her with the catchy Wannabe Latina nickname.357 pages in length, Memoir of a Wannabe Latina: A Latin American Love Song For My Sons is being aggressively promoted to appropriate markets with a focus on the autobiography and personal memoirs category. With U.S. wholesale distribution through Ingram and Baker & Taylor, and pervasive online availability through Amazon, Barnes & Noble and elsewhere, Memoir of a Wannabe Latina meets consumer demand through both retail and library markets with a suggested retail price of $17.95.Additionally, Memoir of a Wannabe Latina can be ordered by retailers or wholesalers for the maximum trade discount price set by the author in quantities of ten or more from the Outskirts Press Direct bookstore at www.outskirtspress.com/bookstore.ISBN: 9781432763657Format: 7 x 10 paperbackSRP: $17.95For more information or to contact the author, visit www.outskirtspress.com/wannabelatina.About the author:Anne Kirchheimer grew up in New York, but has spent decades living in Boston where she has worked as an award-winning reporter, bilingual columnist and feature writer for The Boston Globe. As a freelance writer, her work has appeared in US Magazine and many other local and national magazines. Memoir of a Wannabe Latina is her first book.About Outskirts Press, Inc.Outskirts Press, Inc. offers full-service, custom self-publishing and book marketing services for authors seeking a cost-effective, fast, and flexible way to publish and distribute their books worldwide while retaining all their rights and full creative control. Available for authors globally at www.outskirtspress.com and located on the outskirts of Denver, Colorado, Outskirts Press represents the future of book publishing, today.###Outskirts Press, Inc., 10940 S. Parker Rd - 515, Parker, Colorado 80134http://outskirtspress.com 1-888-OP-BOOKS

description.hltext_display: Vince Cable's controversial remarks about Rupert Murdoch and the subsequent loss of some of his powers feature on most newspaper front pages.
description.content:
The Independent headline reads: "The man who declared war on Murdoch, and lost". Other titles play on the business secretary's name. The Times has: "Cable's power cut" while the Daily Mirror's offering is: "Cable unplugged". In the view of the Sun, one of Mr Murdoch's daily papers, he should have been demoted at the very least.
The Daily Telegraph says the prime minister's decision to strip Mr Cable of his responsibilities for overseeing media policy has left him humiliated. "How could he be so daft?" the Daily Express asks.
The Times, owned by Mr Murdoch, says that although Mr Cable has survived in the cabinet, questions remain about his judgment and impartiality.
The Financial Times says the political sanctity of "St Vince" has evaporated as a result of his comments.
The crimes of Stephen Griffiths - who murdered three women in Bradford and called himself "the crossbow cannibal" - take up many pages in the press.
His life sentence is the main story for the Daily Mail, the Mirror, the Sun and the Daily Star.
The Sun describes him as a pure evil monster who hated people and killed for kicks.
The Mail says he studied the sickest crimes in history, then turned practitioner.
The Guardian says the real fashion accessory this winter is the aluminium foil cape that has been proliferating at Heathrow and St Pancras Station. The "silver swaddlers" as they are often referred to, are made from an ultra-insulating material.
They are used to retain body heat in survival situations and are fast becoming the look of the "Big Freeze". But, the paper warns, outdoor stores are fast selling out and online orders risk being delayed by the weather.

description.hltext_display: Nova gets $10m order from major foundry
description.author: noreply@allvoices.com
description.content: The company will fill the order during the first half of 2011. Nova president and CEO Gabi Seligsohn said, We continue to strengthen our position in the foundry segment. This segment plays a key role in leading edge end markets such as tablet computers, smartphones and cellular infrastructure.

description.hltext_display: Cabaret e musica per beneficenza
description.content:
Otranto Vacanze ... In occasione del VI Festival della SolidarietÃ viene presentata domani ad Altamura la fondazione 'Banca Solidale di Puglia e Basilicata' allo scopo di attivare fondi e promuovere la cultura della solidarietÃ e della responsabilitÃ sociale
Inserito da dinoxotranto il giorno 22/12/2010 alle 9.44 - Voti: 2 - Commenti: 0

description.hltext_display: Borse europee attese poco mosse, pesano materie prime
description.content:
LONDRA
La debolezza dei prezzi dei metalli potrebbe pesare sull'azionario.
Secondo i bookmaker finanziari l'indice Ftse Ã¨ atteso da stabile a calo di 4 punti, il Dax tra 2 punti al rialzo e 4 al ribasso, Cac-40 in calo di 2-3 punti.
Gli investitori guarderanno alla situazione geopolitica, dopo che la Corea del Sud ha annunciato esercitazioni militari per oggi.
Le azioni legate ai prezzi delle materie prime saranno al centro dell'attenzione e potrebbero spingere a prese di profitto dopo i recenti rialzi. L'indice STOXX Europe 600 delle materie prime questo mese Ã¨ salito del 12%.
Sul sito www.reuters.it le altre notizie Reuters in italiano
Le top news anche su www.twitter.com/reuters_italia

description.hltext_display: Euro recupera terreno in Asia dopo debolezza ieri
description.content:
TOKYO
Gli ultimi colpi sono venuti da Moody's, che ha avvertito che potrebbe tagliare rating del Portogallo e da Fitch, che ha detto la stessa cosa della Grecia ieri.
"Anche se si potrebbe supporre il mercato era diventato un po' insensibile a tali notizie, bisogna evidenziare che invece gli spread dei titoli periferici si sono ampliati di nuovo e l'euro rimane sotto pressione" dice David Watt, strategist valutario a RBC Dominion.
L'euro poco prima delle ore 8 italiane Ã¨ in rialzo dello 0,34% in Asia a 1,3139/42 dollari.
Contro yen l'eruo Ã¨ a 109,98/0,03 yen in rialzo dello 0,26%.
Il dollaro/yen cede lo 0,08% a 83,70/73..
sul sito www.reuters.it altre notizie Reuters in italiano
le top news anche su www.twitter.com/reuters_italia

description.hltext_display: South Stream, Poli: Eni ci sarÃ se studio fattibilitÃ positivo
description.content:
MILANO
A dirlo Ã¨ il presidente dell'Eni, Roberto Poli, in una lunga intervista a Il Sole-24 Ore nella quale il manager affronta diversi temi che riguardano la major italiana.
"A oggi Eni Ã¨ impegnata con Gazprom a realizzare uno studio di fattibilitÃ tecnica, commerciale, economica e finanziaria. Solo se le analisi avranno esito positivo, Eni assumerÃ la decisione finale di partecipare alla costruzione del gasdotto", dice Poli sottolineando che la condizione inderogabile per la partecipazione dell'Eni al progetto Ã¨ "l'economicitÃ e la sua finanziabilitÃ ".
Eni e Gazprom hanno sottoscritto una jv venture per realizzare la parte a mare del gasdotto che attraverserÃ il Mar Nero. Nel progetto dovrebbero entrare anche la francese Edf e la tedesca Wintershall. Il secondo tratto, quello onshore Ã¨ diviso in due tronconi, in direzione Nord e direzione Sud.
Quanto all'ipotesi di separare la rete del gas di Snam Rete Gas dal gruppo, per Poli "Ã¨ un'ipotesi superata dai fatti. Eni ha ridotto la sua quota di mercato del gas in Italia da circa il 90% del 2000 al 39% del 2010...ormai la tesi della separazione, magari plausibile 7-8 anni fa, Ã¨ superata".
Domani, annuncia Poli, l'Ad, Paolo Scaroni, incontrerÃ a Mosca il suo omologo di Gazprom Alexei Millei per rinegoziare i costi degli accordi take or pay sulla fornitura del gas a lungo termini in scadenza al 2035. Alla domanda se Eni chiederÃ uno sconto a Gazprom, alla luce della divaricazione dei prezzi creatasi fra quelli spot applicati sui mercati internazionali e quelli derivanti dai contratti a lunga scadenza, Poli risponde cosÃ¬: "Le rinegoziazioni dei contratti di fornitura sono una costante di questa industria e le nostre relazioni cinquantennali con Gazprom ci rassicurano in tal senso".
Infine, secondo Poli, "Eni Ã¨ e resta indipendente" rispetto alle indicazioni del governo e non "risultano" al presidente dell'Eni tensioni con il dipartimento di Stato Usa per i rapporti privilegiati fra Italia e Russia in tema di energia, come riportato dai file di Wikileaks nei giorni scorsi.

description.hltext_display: Germania, prezzi import novembre +10% su anno, max novembre 2000
description.content:
BERLINO
E' quanto emerge dai dati dell'Ufficio federale di statistica tedesco dopo una lettura di ottobre di rispettivi -0,2% e +9,2%.
I dati sono decisamente sopra le attese degli analisti consultati da Reuters, che prevedevano un aumento limitato allo 0,5% su mese e del 9,3% su anno..
sul sito www.reuters.it altre notizie Reuters in italiano
Le top news anche su www.twitter.com/reuters_italia

description.hltext_display: Borse Asia Pacifico, indici in lieve rialzo, ma cala Shanghai
description.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Le borse asiatiche sono rimaste ancorate ai livelli della seduta precedente, in un mercato sottile in vista delle festivitÃ natalizie, sostenuto dal tono positivo di Usa ed Europa ieri.
Fa eccezione Shanghai che lascia sul terreno qusi l'1%.
Sullo sfondo i timori per il debito in Europa, con alcuni analisti che ritengono che la divisa unica giÃ sconti i problemi per Grecia, Portogallo, Spagna, Irlanda e Belgio.
L'azionario Ã¨ stato sostenuto anche dalle previsioni di una revisione al rialzo del Pil Usa, dai dati che saranno diffusi oggi nel primo pomeriggio.
Poco dopo le 8,30 l'indice Msci, che esclude Tokyo, sale dello 0,2%.
"Nei mercato valutari e dei bond prevale l'avversione al rischio. Ma in molti altri abbiamo visto una tendenza opposta", dice Tohru Sasaki, strategist di JPMorgan Chase Bank a Tokyo.
La borsa di Tokyo ha chiuso in leggero ribasso dopo aver toccato in apertura un massimo da sette mesi.
SHANGHAI ha chiuso in ribasso dello 0,9% dopo le speculazioni sulle azioni del settore immobiliare di ieri, con un generale rallentamento della liquiditÃ in arrivo sul mercato azionario.
HONG KONG vede acquisti titoli dei settori raffinazione ed energia, come Sinopec, tra i migliori del listino grazie ai prezzi di greggio e carburante.
SEOUL torna sui massimi da 38 mesi, ma poi chiude piatta, con acquisti sul settore auto e quindi su Kia Motors e le banche negative.
TAIWAN ha chiuso in rialzo dello 0,37%. Acquisti su societÃ tecnologiche come HTC e sul settore logistica che hanno migliori prospettive di utile.
SINGAPORE positiva, ma Wilmar International, la piÃ¹ grande societÃ quotata che produce olio di palma, ha fatto peggio del mercato a causa degli accordi nel settore immobiliare in Cina, che, secondo i trader, hanno portato la societÃ a deviare dalla sua attivitÃ tradizionale.
SYDNEY in lieve rialzo. Sostenuti i minerari sulla scia dei prezzi del rame, ma pesa il settore banche sul quale gli investitori prendono profitto.
La borsa indiana segue le altre piazze dell'area asiatica, sostenuta dagli acquisti nei settori banche e metalli.

description.hltext_display: Borsa Tokyo chiude in leggero ribasso dopo massimo da 7 mesi
description.content:
TOKYO
Il governo giapponese ha tagliato le previsioni su esportazioni e fiducia delle imprese a causa del rallentamento della ripresa in Asia e dello yen forte. Ha aggiunto che l'economia Ã¨ in una fase di stallo, sottolineando le difficoltÃ per quanto riguarda l'occupazione.
Ma il tono di fondo rimane forte, anche se in questi giorni il mercato Ã¨ sottile in vista delle festivitÃ natalizie e riflette il tono positivo delle borse a livello globale e le buone prospettive per il Nikkei nel 2011.
Ulvac Ã¨ salita del 3% dopo che il presidente ha detto a Reuters che la domanda di alcuni dei suoi prodotti Ã¨ forte. Canon del 2,2% dopo che la societÃ ha previsto un utile operativo migliore delle attese a fine anno.
L'indice Nikkei ha segnato un ribasso dello 0,23% 10.346,48 punti, il Topix dello 0,05% a 905,78.

description.hltext_display: Euro, Saccomanni: Ã¨ forte, fondamentali Europa meglio di Usa
description.content:
ROMA
"Le oscillazioni si devono al fatto che la gente si muove dall'euro al dollaro e viceversa, a seconda delle notizie del momento. Ma la moneta Ã¨ lÃ¬, forte perchÃ© i fondamentali dell'Europa sono piÃ¹ solidi di quelli degli Usa", ha detto Saccomanni.
Secondo il direttore della Banca d'Italia, che ha ricordato nell'intervista lo scomparso Tommaso Padoa-Schioppa, gli afflussi di capitale verso la Cina, il Brasile e le altre economie emergenti dove si investe a tassi elevati indebitandosi nei paesi sviluppati a tassi prossimi allo zero prima o poi creerÃ una bolla speculativa.
Di qui l'idea, portata avanti da Padoa Schioppa per incarico della presidenza della Francia, di un progetto di riforma del mercato monetario internazionale per dare meno spazio alla speculazione.
"Pensava a una gestione multilaterale dei cambi, con zone obiettivo e parametri prefissati. Lo preoccupavano le troppe oscillazioni delle monete", ha ricordato Saccomani riferendo il progetto di Padoa Schioppa.
Sul sito www.reuters.it altre notizie Reuters in italiano
Le top news anche su www.twitter.com/reuters_italia

description.hltext_display: NFL: Chicago Bears clinch division
description.content:
Devin Hester broke the NFL record for returning touchdowns as the Chicago Bears beat Minnesota Viking 40-14 to clinch the NFC North title.
Wide receiver Hester, who had already caught a 15-yard touchdown pass in the second quarter, was stopped just short of the line when returning the second-half kick-off but ran a subsequent punt 64 yards into the end zone for the 14th returning touchdown of his career - one ahead of Brian Mitchell, whose record he equalled against Seattle earlier this season.
Chicago QB Jay Cutler connected with Johnny Knox for a 67-yard touchdown and also found Rashied Davis in the end zone.
Opposite number Favre, who had hit Percy Harvin for an early touchdown, was forced off in the second quarter after hitting his head on the frozen turf of TCF Bank Stadium having been tackled by Corey Wootton.
Replacement Joe Webb scored a 13-yard running touchdown but threw two interceptions as the Bears' defence claimed four turnovers and four sacks.

description.hltext_display: Borsa Milano parte poco mossa, corrono titoli galassia Ligresti
description.content:
MILANO
Sullo sfondo restano i timori per la situazione geopolitica dopo che la Corea del Sud ha annunciato esercitazioni militari per oggi.
Poco dopo l'avvio, l'indice FTSE MIB sale dello 0,29%, cosÃ¬ come l'AllShare, mentre il MidCap Ã¨ invariato.
Qualche spunto sulle banche, bene FIAT in salita dello 0,6%.
Corrono le societÃ della galassia Ligresti: FONDIARIA-SAI sale dell'1,76% e la controllante PREMAFIN del 2,31%. Oggi i Ligresti e sette banche creditrici firmeranno l'accordo per la rimodulazione dei 320 milioni di debito Premafin, secondo quanto riportano alcuni quotidiani.
Sul sito www.reuters.it altre notizie Reuters in italiano.
Le top news anche su www.twitter.com/reuters_italia

description.content:
ARTICOLO | di AndrÃ© Gorz
UN MONDO SENZA ASCESA SOCIALE
Un testo di AndrÃ© Gorz sull'universitÃ dopo il Maggio francese nel quale invitava a varcare il confine tra i campus e la societÃ . Un'appassionata testimonianza di una tensione civile che va applicata ai conflitti del presente, dove gli atenei sono diventati nodi nella produzione della ricchezza
L'UniversitÃ non puÃ² funzionare: impediamole dunque di funzionare perchÃ© l'impossibilitÃ diventi manifesta. Nessuna riforma, di nessun tipo, puÃ² rendere questa istituzione di nuovo vitale; combattiamo dunque le riforme, nei [...]

description.content: This is a PDF report.

description.hltext_display: Emerging nations upbeat on 2011
description.content:
Lord Hutton's review of the future of the public sector pension schemes has been urged to recommend that they be changed to career average schemes. Read more
Costain bid rejected by Mouchel
22-Dec
Engineering group Costain confirms that it has had a takeover proposal rejected by outsourcing company Mouchel. Read more
Japan's export growth accelerates
22-Dec
Japanese export growth expands for the first time in nine months in November but the government forecasts slower economic growth Read more 22-Dec
A survey of economic prospects for 2011 suggests emerging economies are more optimistic than the richer G7 nations. Read more
Ernst & Young in Lehman lawsuit
22-Dec
Accountancy giant Ernst & Young is sued by New York's attorney general over its role in the collapse of Lehman Brothers. Read more
Concern over supermarkets' growth
22-Dec
Concerns are raised about the growth of the 'big four' supermarkets after BBC research finds at least 577 new stores were approved in the UK in two years. Read more
Two fight over growth town sites
22-Dec
Two supermarkets fight for new sites in a Northamptonshire town which is expected to grow over the next decade. Read more
Vince Cable will stay in cabinet
21-Dec
Vince Cable told undercover reporters he planned to block Rupert Murdoch's efforts to take full control of BSkyB, according to the BBC's Robert Peston. Read more

description.hltext_display: El Ibex continÃºa hoy con alzas
description.content:
Apertura en EspaÃÂ±
Luis Loureiro - 22/12/2010 09:08h El Ibex 35 avanza tras la apertura un +0.28%, hasta los 10.232 puntos, con 29 de sus valores en positivo y 6 en rojo. Las mayores ganancias son a esta hora para BME, del +1.40%, Sacyr +1.20% y Abengoa, que se anota un +1.09%. En negativo destacan Banesto -0.64%, Bankinter, que recoge beneficios tras liderar ayer las subidas, bajo ahora un -0.50%, y Acciona -0.39%.

description.hltext_display: [ë§ì¼in][í¬ë ë§ë§ê°]"ì ë¶, MA ìê¸ì¶ì²ì¡°ì¬ ë¹ì°í ê²°ì "
NYPD trains personnel to anticipate, counter Mumbai type terror attack
description.content:
The New York Police Department recently ran an anti-terrorism exercise that deliberately mirrored the November 2008 terror massacre on the city of Mumbai.
According to the Wall Street Journal, a team of terrorists unleashed a coordinated series of bombings and gun attacks around the city in the simulation.
At one point, terrorists attacked New York police officials visiting wounded officers in a hospital. By the time the daylong attacks were over, dozens of people had been killed and many more wounded.
The NYPD simulation was different from any of the terrorist incidents that have actually hit New York, such as the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks where terrorists hijacked planes to destroy the World Trade Center, or the foiled Times Square car-bombing attempt in May of this year.
It maybe recalled that in the Mumbai terror attack,10 gunmen attacked various locations,including two luxury hotels, a hospital and a railway station.
The attack stretched on for three days as hostages were taken at several of the locations. Ultimately, 174 people were killed.
Until Mumbai, NYPD counter-terrorism officials felt reasonably comfortable that they were prepared for any type of terrorist attack. But that comfort level was built on preparing for a single event, not a series of coordinated attacks that would terrorize a city for days on end.
"The Mumbai attack two years ago was a bit of a game changer," Mitchell Silber, head of the NYPD's intelligence analysis division, said.
He added: "It was a model that most counterterrorism practitioners hadn't really considered. The armed gunmen roaming around the city taking hostages, that wasn't something we had seen by any jihadist group. That was a real eye-opener."
The latest simulation made additional sense, he said, in light of the rumors this past fall that jihadists were planning another "Mumbai-style" attack somewhere in Europe.
According to a memo reviewed by The Wall Street Journal, the police were given a fictional scenario that began with President Barack Obama visiting New York for a bill signing. At the same time, convicted Times Square bomber Faisal Shahzad was scheduled to appear in federal court.
The attacks began with bombings in downtown that resulted in 18 dead and dozens injured. The president went ahead with the bill signing at the World Trade Center site, when another bomb went off nearby. He was whisked away.
The attack wasn't over. Six gunmen piled out of a van at Herald Square and opened fire on shoppers and pedestrians. They then entered the Macy's department store and took 26 hostages.
As in Mumbai, police in the simulation had trouble containing and anticipating the terrorists. At one point, police who tried to rescue hostages were shot by snipers.
Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and Chief of Department Joseph Esposito went to Bellevue Hospital to visit wounded police officers, then both were incapacitated when a bomb exploded inside the emergency room, according to the simulation.
This is the eighth such large-scale tabletop exercise held by the NYPD since Mumbai, according to Paul Browne, the NYPD's spokesman.
He said the exercise provided several valuable lessons.
For instance, conventional wisdom was that the best way to deal with multiple subway bombings was to shut down all mass transportation and evacuate everyone by foot.
The exercise showed the advantage of continuing to use buses during an attack to shepherd civilians out of lower Manhattan.
Browne said the exercise also served as a reminder that the NYPD needs to obtain or update floor plans of the city's large department stores in case hostage-taking or some other standoff occurs there.
Currently, the NYPD keeps floor plan copies for all of the city's major hotels and many popular buildings.
The department has taken other steps to prepare for a similar attack.
Since Mumbai, the NYPD has trained and equipped an addition 375 officers to use "heavy weapons" for a prolonged siege situation.
The heavy weapons-MP5 submachine guns and Mini-14 semiautomatic carbine rifles-are needed to counteract military-style assault weapons like the ones used in Mumbai.
Lastly, police are preparing for more chaos. They now assume that when they advise civilians to "shelter in place," many will flee the island on foot as they did during the last major power blackout. That means police will need to protect pedestrians leaving Manhattan via the East River bridges or ferries. (ANI)

description.hltext_display: Ontmoetingen met buitenaardse wezens met 'farao-maskers'
description.content:
Het Nieuw-Zeelandse leger heeft woensdag zo'n 2.000 pagina's aan vertrouwelijke documenten over UFO-meldingen vrijgegeven. Het gaat over meldingen van burgers, piloten en militairen die binnenstroomden van 1954 tot 2009.
De documenten omvatten onder meer tekeningen van vliegende schotels en beschrijvingen van buitenaardse wezens met 'farao-maskers'. Ook zouden bepaalde mensen als het ware buitenaardse geschriften hebben gevonden.
Het leger benadrukt dat het de meldingen niet heeft onderzocht. Daar zou onvoldoende geld en personeel voor zijn geweest.
''We zijn gewoon een verzamelpunt voor de informatie. We doen er verder niets mee'', aldus luchtmachtleider Kavvae Tamariki in de krant Dominion Post. De documenten werden vrijgegeven naar aanleiding van een wet op de openbaarheid.

description.hltext_display: Indonesian police seize two million illegal porn videos in Jakarta
description.author: noreply@allvoices.com
description.content:
More than two million illegal pornographic videos were recently seized by Indonesian authorities in Jakarta, officials said on Wednesday.
The 2,079,802 pirated pornographic movies were seized by the Metro Jaya Police in a warehouse in Glodok, Tamansari and West Jakarta. The previous arrests of six dealers with over 1,000 videos led police to the massive stash.
Authorities are still looking for the owner of the videos, but said the seized videos include copies of Japanese and Western pornographic movies. Master copies were also found, leading authorities to suspect the owner of the warehouse was also producing his own pornographic movies. (

description.hltext_display: NFC North: Bears still have work to do
description.content: (Sports Network) - Now that the Chicago Bears are back in the playoffs and NFC North champions for the first time since reaching the Super Bowl in 2006, there's still a few hurdles to clear before making a deep postseason run. The Bears clinched a division title in impressive fashion by handing the division-rival Minnesota Vikings a 40-14 beating on a frigid Monday night at TCF Bank Stadium in Minnesota. They overcame not knowing where the game was going to be held earlier in the week after the roof collapsed at the Metrodome and brushed off Brett Favre's return from a shoulder injury to wax their division co-tenants. Rookie defensive end Corey Wootton introduced himself to Favre by knocking the future Hall of Famer out of the game with a concussion on his first career sack during the second quarter. Wootton's sack was one of four recorded by a defense that generated five takeaways, including interceptions by cornerback Charles Tillman, safety Chris Harris and defensive end Julius Peppers. Peppers, in his first year with Chicago, was appreciative of his teammates. "I see these guys every day," Peppers said postgame. "I see these guys work. I see what type of players we have on this team and I see the coaches. The coaches don't accept anything but our best. "Anytime you have that combination of things working together, good things have to happen. The football gods make sure good things happen to people who work hard and do things right." Peppers contributed five tackles and two tipped passes for the Bears, who still have games remaining against the Jets and Packers. Home-field advantage appears to be headed Atlanta's way since the Falcons are 12-2, but the Bears are the first team to clinch a division this season. Chicago has won six of its last seven games and improved to 6-1 as the visitor. The road record and five straight wins as the visitor should strike fear in Chicago's playoff opponent since it has proven winning as the guest is not a problem. Quarterback Jay Cutler continued his solid play last night with three touchdown passes to just one interception, and rebounded from an ugly showing in a 36-7 home loss to New England in Week 14. Last night Cutler threw for just 194 yards, but has eight TD passes in his last four games. At this time of year the Bears can't afford sloppy performances, especially from their quarterback, and need running back Matt Forte at his best. Forte's season has been inconsistent and he ran for 92 yards on 17 carries against the Vikings. He has only two 100-yard rushing games this season and will be relied on heavily come playoff time. Return man Devin Hester set Chicago up with great field position last night and even established the all-time NFL record for kick return touchdowns with the 14th kick return TD of his career. Hester is tied with Eric Metcalf with 10 punt returns for a score and broke the combined mark previously held by Brian Mitchell. Hester was thankful for the rest of his special teams partners after his big game. "I know the success is from those guys," an emotional Hester said. "I hate sitting here and taking all the glory. I wish those other 10 guys were up here and you were asking them questions because they deserve to be up here. I love them. All the glory goes to them." Chicago is hoping all the glory will eventually end up in the Windy City. VIKINGS: Here we go again. The never-ending saga, or soap opera, that is Brett Favre reared its head possibly for the last time in Monday night's brutal loss to rival Chicago. The grizzled veteran, who was originally ruled out earlier in the week, shook off a shoulder injury before getting re-acquainted with the ground. Favre was sacked by Bears rookie DE Corey Wootton early in the second quarter and never returned after suffering what appeared to be a concussion. Favre's tumultuous season that has been riddled by injuries and off-the-field news came to a thud after making a gutsy return. Wootton ended any chance of a miraculous Favre comeback by slamming the QB to the frozen ground after he had led the Vikings to a touchdown on the opening drive. "He gave them a boost," acknowledged Bears head coach Lovie Smith. "Whenever you have one of the all-time great players to play the game all of a sudden be ready to go, it has to give your team a boost. But our guys met the challenge." Minnesota's two-year run as NFC North champions ended weeks ago, but this season has left many to wonder what happened and if this team can move on successfully under interim head coach Leslie Frazier. Finding a quarterback to run the show will be the team's next challenge since Favre appears ready to ride off in the sunset and Tarvaris Jackson has failed several times to prove that he can play at this level. Joe Webb may not be the answer either after he threw for 129 yards and a pair of interceptions. Webb also ran for a score. While the passing attack never got off the icy ground at TCF Bank Stadium -- the home of the University of Minnesota -- running back Adrian Peterson was inactive with an ankle injury and rookie Toby Gerhart got the start, rushing for a career-best 77 yards on 16 carries. The numbers were pretty even, but the Bears had the advantage by forcing five takeaways, including three INTs, and having return man Devin Hester, who had a 64-yard punt return for a score. The Vikings are hoping Peterson will make a return this weekend in Philadelphia and spoil the Eagles' chances of capturing an NFC East title on their watch. Witnessing a team celebrate on back-to-back weeks is not on Minnesota's agenda. LIONS: The upstart Detroit Lions are on their longest winning streak -- two games -- since a three-game run midway through the 2007 campaign. Detroit possibly ruined the playoff chances for both Green Bay and Tampa Bay with consecutive wins, and squeezed out a 23-20 overtime triumph against the Buccaneers on the road this past Sunday. Dave Rayner's 28-yard field goal in overtime snapped the Lions' NFL-record 26-game road losing streak. Detroit's last road win came in Chicago, 16-7, on October 28, 2007. Maurice Morris ran for 109 yards and a score on 15 carries and reached the 100-yard mark in rushing for the first time since last Dec. 20 versus Arizona. Drew Stanton had another strong day under center, throwing for 252 yards with a touchdown pass to Nate Burleson. Calvin Johnson was his usual dominant self with 152 yards on 10 receptions, but didn't have to do it alone this time. "That's been the whole plan for what we want to do offensively: to be that multi-dimensional group," said head coach Jim Schwartz, who earned his first road win at the helm. "Where, if you decided to try and take one thing away we can make you pay with the other. "We've been derailed in that a little bit at times, but we've found a way -- particularly later in the season under some adverse circumstances." The Lions' hopes were derailed when franchise quarterback Matthew Stafford went down for the second time this season with a shoulder injury, and it would be foolish to rush him back with two games left on the schedule. Detroit already knows what he means to the offense and putting him at risk in Miami or back at home versus Minnesota is not the best idea. Stanton should handle the snaps for the rest of the campaign to showcase his talents for possibly a backup gig somewhere else. Don't forget Detroit backup QB Shaun Hill is also out due to injury. PACKERS: "So close, yet so far away." -- Hall and Oates. Those words couldn't ring more true for the Green Bay Packers, who had the NFL's top team -- the New England Patriots -- on the ropes for most of Sunday's 31-27 road loss. It was the third consecutive road setback for a Packers team that is out of the wild card picture with an 8-6 record. A 6-4 mark in conference play won't help either and the absence of Aaron Rodgers didn't seem to bother Green Bay, as backup Matt Flynn surprised everyone with 251 yards and three scores with an interception. Flynn, as predicted by yours truly, was supposed to fail miserably on the hallowed grounds of Gillette Stadium, but was sacked and stripped off the ball on the game's final play by Patriots linebacker Tully Banta-Cain. New England DT Vince Wilfork landed on the loose ball and possibly squashed the Packers' chances of a playoff berth as well. Flynn was also sacked five times. "I think for the people that don't know Matt Flynn, I think they got to look inside and see what type of person and what kind of player he is," said Packers head coach Mike McCarthy. "To have your first start in the NFL against Tom Brady at New England, the level that they are playing at right now, Sunday Night Football, it doesn't get much bigger than that." Packers defensive end Ryan Pickett said the team is ready for the New York Giants at home so it can get this loss out of the way. Pickett also stated how confident Green Bay was in leaving Foxborough with a win, but the loss will be a building block for the rest of the season and possibly the playoffs. After hosting the Giants, the Packers will entertain NFC North-champion Chicago at Lambeau Field. The conditions won't bother the Bears since they play at Soldier Field and beat the Vikings outdoors at the University of Minnesota. Green Bay has won three straight at home and hopes to have Rodgers back in the fold. Rodgers sustained his second concussion of the season in a loss at Detroit on Dec. 12 and his status for Sunday is unclear. "Well, I don't have all the information for Aaron," McCarthy said Monday. "Just as I stated last night after the game, I'll have an update for you Wednesday. We're still going through our medical process now with all of our players." Two more wins and the Packers will be 10-6 and in the driver's seat for a postseason berth thanks to several tiebreaker scenarios. They sport a 6-4 mark in conference play and are battling with New Orleans and the Giants for a wild card berth.

description.hltext_display: EUROPEAN EQUITY OPENING HEADLINES INCLUDING: Lagardere is in talks to sell all assets outside France
description.content:
ASIA
Nikkei (-0.23%) slipped from its 7-month intraday high, as downbeat comments by the Prime Minister on the economy prompted investors to adjust positions around new levels. (RTRS)
US
Stocks finished-off session highs after benefiting from an easing of tensions in the Korea Peninsula. Financials and basic materials lead the S&P 500, while consumer goods and health care alongside utilities were the only sectors in negative territory. It is worth noting the index managed to complete its recovery from the plunge that followed Lehmanâs collapse in 2008, finishing above the 1,251 level. In terms of corporate news, Adobe (+5.96%) following yesterdayâs beat on earnings and better than expected forecast. In addition, Dell (+3.59%) after co.âs CEO purchased 7.4mln additional shares of the computer maker. Finally, at the closing bell, the DJIA closed up 0.48% at 11533.16, the S&P 500 closed up 0.60% at 1254.60 and the NASDAQ 100 closed up 0.52% at 2234.57.
Nike - Q2 EPS USD 0.94 vs. Exp. USD 0.88, Q2 revenue USD 4.84bln vs. Exp. USD 4.82bln and Q2 brand futures orders up 11%. Says inventories up 8% vs. year ago at Nov. 30 and says co. bought back 3.5mln shares in common stock in Q2. (Sources) Co. shares were down 2.4% in after-market trade.
Cintas - Q2 EPS USD 0.38 vs. Exp. USD 0.38 and Q2 revenue USD 936.6mln vs. Exp. USD 915.67mln. Co. reaffirms forecast for year EPS and revenue and says still expects full year revenue USD 3.55-3.75bln. (Sources)
UK
Rio Tinto â Co. is finalising a USD 3.8bln takeover bid for Africa-focused Riversdale, according to sources. (RTRS)
BT â Ofcom has issued a statement of objections to co. arguing that the telco has infringed competition law in relation to the pricing of its Wholesale Calls product between July 2008 and April 2009. (Sources)
FRANCE Â Lagardere - Co. is in talks to sell all assets outside France for EUR 600-700mln, according to sources. (RTRS)
LVMH - Co. says it crossed the threshold of 20% of Hermes, and says it now owns more than 21.3mln Hermes shares. (RTRS)
GERMANY
Deutsche Bank - Co. agreed to pay USD 553.6mln to avoid US criminal charges over fraudulent tax shelters that generated USD 29bln in âbogusâ tax losses. The US Justice Dept. agreed not to prosecute co. for fraud or tax evasion for enabling wealthy US citizens to avoid USD 5.9bln in taxes, after the bank admitted criminal wrongdoing. (Sources)
Adidas â Co. may increase sales by as much as EUR 1bln in coming years as the supporting-goods maker aims to surpass Nike. (Boersen-Zeitung)
PAN- EUROPEAN
Citgroup warned of a fresh wave of bank failures and a string of sovereign defaults in Europe unless EU leaders come up with a credible response to the crisis. (Telegraph) Professor Willem Buiter, the banks chief economist, said the Eurozone was paralysed by a âgame of chickenâ between the ECB and EMU governments.
Nokia â According to industry sources, Co. are in talks with Microsoft, and could soon bring to market smartphones with Windows. (Sources)
BBVA â Co. will pay a third interim dividend against the 2010 results. (Sources)
SMI
Novartis â Co.âs Hexel and Sandoz units will cut 250 jobs in Germany. (FT Deutschland)
ABB â Co. and Baldor say they have received a request for additional information from the antitrust division of the US department of Justice regarding co.âs pending acquisition of Baldor. (Sources)
BROKER MOVES
BASF: S&P ER UPGRADES TO BUY FROM HOLD

description.hltext_display: Nominations open for new Tuvalu PM
description.content:
Nominations are open for candidates interested in the role of Tuvaluâs Prime Minister after parliament unexpectedly dissolved yesterday.
Eight out of seven members of parliament voted in favour of the no confidence vote in the government of Prime Minister Maatia Toafa during Tuesdayâs session, with the Minister for Home Affairs, Willie Telavi, crossing the floor.
Former government secretary, Panapasi Nelesoni, said MPs did raise various financial concerns prior to yesterdayâs vote.
âThe fact that there are no funds available in the budget next year for projects on the outer islands. The other issue is on the medical scheme. There had been rumours according to the opposition that the government may ask families to pay for part of the costs of being referred for medical treatments overseas, like for accommodation. The other issue is incremental salaries for next year, there was concern that there wonât be any.â
Mr Nelesoni said the vote for the PM is expected to take place on Friday morning.

description.hltext_display: Japan's export growth accelerates
description.content:
Lord Hutton's review of the future of the public sector pension schemes has been urged to recommend that they be changed to career average schemes. Read more
Costain bid rejected by Mouchel
22-Dec
Engineering group Costain confirms that it has had a takeover proposal rejected by outsourcing company Mouchel. Read more
22-Dec
Japanese export growth expands for the first time in nine months in November but the government forecasts slower economic growth Read more
Emerging nations upbeat on 2011
22-Dec
A survey of economic prospects for 2011 suggests emerging economies are more optimistic than the richer G7 nations. Read more
Ernst & Young in Lehman lawsuit
22-Dec
Accountancy giant Ernst & Young is sued by New York's attorney general over its role in the collapse of Lehman Brothers. Read more
Concern over supermarkets' growth
22-Dec
Concerns are raised about the growth of the 'big four' supermarkets after BBC research finds at least 577 new stores were approved in the UK in two years. Read more
Two fight over growth town sites
22-Dec
Two supermarkets fight for new sites in a Northamptonshire town which is expected to grow over the next decade. Read more
Vince Cable will stay in cabinet
21-Dec
Vince Cable told undercover reporters he planned to block Rupert Murdoch's efforts to take full control of BSkyB, according to the BBC's Robert Peston. Read more

description.hltext_display: Biosolids company gets help with cleanup
description.content:
The Environmental Health Department is working with a biosolids company to clean up runoff onto an adjoining property.
Health officials went to the Green Acres Biosolids plant on Enos Lane and Union on Tuesday after receiving a complaint from the public.
They found the biosolids plant had been inundated with water from the heavy rains, which caused it to flow onto a nearby property.
"The first thing was to prevent this from recurring, especially with the rain predicted. So we've asked them to take immediate precautions to secure that site, to berm up that area. Then they also are taking the added step of pumping that standing water," said Matt Constantine, Director of Public Health.
Health department workers took samples of the soil to determine the level of contamination. Then they can determine what should be done from that point on.

description.hltext_display: Nueva Zelanda desclasifica informes militares sobre ovnis y extraterrestres
description.content:
SÃ­dney (Australia), 22 dic (EFE).- El EjÃ©rcito de Nueva Zelanda desclasificÃ³ hoy cientos de informes militares hasta ahora secretos sobre presuntos avistamientos de ovnis y encuentros con alienÃ­genas, informÃ³ la radio nacional.
MÃ¡s de 2.000 pÃ¡ginas de datos incluyen testimonios de civiles, militares y pilotos comerciales que afirmaron haber visto en el cielo objetos voladores no identificados, aunque casi todos fueron simples efectos de los movimientos de la luz.
Los informes contienen dibujos de platillos volantes, detalladas descripciones de extraterrestres que portaban mÃ¡scaras similares a las de los faraones egipcios y textos supuestamente escritos por marcianos.
Un caso concreto relata un avistamiento en 1978 de luces extraÃ±as a bordo de un aviÃ³n comercial cerca de la poblaciÃ³n de Kaikoura en la Isla Sur.
De acuerdo a los documentos desclasificados, uno de los pasajeros era un reportero de televisiÃ³n que grabÃ³ imÃ¡genes del fenÃ³meno, que suscitÃ³ un enorme interÃ©s hasta que la Fuerza AÃ©rea lo investigÃ³ y concluyÃ³ que se trataba de un reflejo poco comÃºn del planeta Venus.
Los papeles, elaborados entre 1954 y 2009, fueron publicados bajo la ley de libertad de informaciÃ³n de Nueva Zelanda y todos los nombres fueron suprimidos para proteger la identidad de las personas implicadas.
El EjÃ©rcito neozelandÃ©s no comentarÃ¡ los datos. EFE

description.hltext_display: Medicare Supplemental Insurance Providers - No Such Thing As Too A lot Coverage
description.content: The United States is recognized to have 1 of the most horrific health care systems in the World. Even Cuba has a vastly much better system for providing incredibly low-cost health care of a really high standard, and it is widely recognized that many Americans travel across the border into Canada to get treatment they cannot otherwise afford in their property country. One of the major things folks look at with employment is the "benefits" that come with the pay check at the end of the month.And we've all heard the horror stories of Health Maintenance Organizations (HMO) having stand procedures and policies of refusing all claims at initial, and then only later under duress perhaps honoring their legal obligations to payout advantages to their members. Any treatment deemed experimental of course never gets approved, and it all goes toward the woeful reputation of the United States health care system.This is not to say that the medical treatment is in any way substandard - rather that the financing of the treatment falls well short of the mark in humane terms. Medicare is an insurance system initial legislated for by Lyndon Johnson back in 1965 and it today covers to some extent about 44 million Americans who are either aged (additional than 65 years old) or disabled and who receive social security payments.The real issue with all these insurance programs is that they never cover the entire out-of-pocket expenses incurred by necessary treatments and typically the short fall is well less than can be afforded by folks whose only source of income is social security. And that is where supplemental insurance cover providers come into their own - covering the gap in what the basic insurance refunds and what the true cost of the health care truly costs. And it is quite much worth thinking about because there is nothing far more fundamentally critical than our health, and if we compromise on the insurance we cover ourselves with, we truly are placing our lives at the mercy of chance.More info of Medicare supplemental insurance

description.hltext_display: NBA Season: Dallas spietata a ORL, Kobe espulso e K.O
description.content: Inserito da allen33 il giorno 22/12/2010 alle 9.40 - Voti: 2 - Commenti: 0

description.hltext_display: Waarschuwing ingetrokken
description.content:
DE BILT - Het KNMI heeft de code oranje in Limburg, Brabant en Gelderland woensdagochtend om acht uur ingetrokken. Dat heeft een zegsman van de meteorologische dienst gemeld.
De waarschuwing werd dinsdagavond afgegeven omdat er een grote kans was op ijzel en daardoor flinke gladheid op de wegen in de drie provincies. Het extreme risico op deze gladheid is verdwenen, aldus het KNMI.
In de drie provincies geldt nu net als in de rest van het land code geel. Dat betekent dat er wordt gewaarschuwd voor gladheid door sneeuwresten en/of bevriezing.
Gerelateerde artikelen
21-12: Code oranje in drie provincies
21-12: KNMI waarschuwt voor ijzel
GERELATEERDE BLOGS
Voor reageren op artikelen bij telegraaf.nl en haar subsites gelden huisregels. Klik hier om die regels te lezen.
Als ik de lucht hier bekijk kan code rood ingaan.
Dik, Apeldoorn | 09:43 | 22.12.10
Mensen....het KNMI voorspelt NIETS,ze VERWACHTEN en tussen die 2 woorden zit een verschil :).
Autoch, Toon | 09:42 | 22.12.10
Ben blij dat we hier geen codes hebben. Dan zouden we vanaf dec. tot mrt. continu bestookt worden met code rood. Hier in Oostenrijk gaat alles gewoon door, verkeer, trein, de bouw en het leven. Nederland is sociaal en technisch failiet !
kolenbrander, Hinterglemm | 09:37 | 22.12.10
heb net mijn hondenknip-afspraak afgezegd door waarschuwing ijzel brabant en nog iemand had afgebeld hierdoor. nu wordt het weer ingetrokken. dank jullie wel voor onnodige paniekzaaien. je kunt voorspellen of niet en dit kunnen jullie zelfs niet meer een dag van te voren.
aj., brabant | 09:35 | 22.12.10
Het blijft lastig dat voorspellen, maar liever een keer te veel waarschuwen dan te weinig en achteraf commentaar krijgen.
Waratje, Houten | 09:34 | 22.12.10
Als ik naar de satelliet beelden kijk, weet ik er niet veel van. Maar bij het knmi,V en W,snappen ze het helemaal niet.Die hebben hun geloofwaardig heid decennia geleden al verspeeld. "Werken" daar alleen maar ex politici.
Piet, Dammekant | 09:33 | 22.12.10
Ik reageer nergens meer op en kijk nooit meer op de site van de telegraaf en hoef ook geen gratis telgraaf meer. El;ke reactie die ik plaats wordt toch afgekeurd. onbegrijpelijk. er staats niets verkeerd in. maar ja, de telegraaf kan niet tegen kritiek, hypocriete klootzakken zijn jullie.
Buuts, Staphorst | 09:26 | 22.12.10
Heel raar dit bericht, liep om 8:15 buiten en toen begon het pas te miezeren wat natuurlijk resulteerde in gladde wegen. Nu woon ik in Noord Brabant dus snap niet dat ze dan om 8:00 de code oranje intrekken terwijl het om 8:15 is begonnen? Wie is er nu gek?
Erwin, Roosendaal | 09:25 | 22.12.10
onnodige commotie en voor wat ? mn man bracht me weg vanmorgen , de gladheid is niets en de drukte ook niets ! dus allemaal zwaar overtrokken met al die waarschuwingen.
babs, Rotterdam | 09:20 | 22.12.10
Altijd naar de belgische weerman kijken deze hebben het meestal goed en liegen niet. Eigelijk moesten ze bij de knmi eens flink wat kwakzalvers de deur wijzen. Dat geeft gerust stelling en neemt stres weg.
frenske, weert | 09:18 | 22.12.10
En weer zaten ze mis.
Bert, Drenthe | 09:13 | 22.12.10
En wij hier in het oosten kijken naar het duitse weerbericht die is 100% anders en klopt altijd vergeleken met pietje paulus ma of rtl4 weer .
wil, overijsel | 09:13 | 22.12.10
En weer een code rood die niet nodig was. Mensen let toch gewoon zelf een beetje op en luister niet meer naar die onzin. Alsof het KNMI bij elke weg om de honderd meter iemand heeft staan die met zn schoenen over het wegdek schuifelt. Ze weten prima de algemene weersvoorspelling te doen maar op het moment dat er extremer weer is zijn er teveel factoren en die vang je nooit in modelletjes. Dus lekker zelf opletten, voorzichtig zijn maar vooral niet angstig, tis maar ijs en sneeuw.
Realist, Utrecht | 09:10 | 22.12.10
Offenbach krijgt weer eens gelijk maar ja die voorspellen het weer zonder rekening te houden met klimaatopwarming. Bij het knmi is de wens vader van de gedachte.
PVV, Elst | 09:07 | 22.12.10
gewoon doen wat wij ook hebben gedaan en s'ochtends uit je raam kijken of er gereden kan worden. in Brabant zou het flink gaan ijzelen, maar hier was niets van te zien, dus niks aan de hand. maar liever wel gewaarschuwd worden, is nooit overbodig
cindy, tilburg | 09:06 | 22.12.10
Het kan vriezen het kan dooien. Vooruit: scheuren maar weer met die Ferrari uhh brommobiel. Voorwielaandrijving... met vliegwiel.
Herman, Wageningen | 09:02 | 22.12.10
Veel mensen uit ZO Brabant kijken naar de Belgische weersvooruitzichten op de Belgische teletekst (blz.306). Deze kloppen in tegenstelling met het KNMI voor zeker 90%. Zij voorspelden droog weer met een zeer kleine kans op afwijking. Niks weeralarm

description.hltext_display: Muslim and Tamil parties in Sri Lanka to form an alliance to find a political solution to ethnic issue
description.content:
* Dec 21, Colombo: Several Tamil and Muslim political parties in Sri Lanka have agreed to form an alliance to find a solution to the ethnic issue.
The decision to form an alliance between the Muslim and Tamil political parties will continue alongside the forum of Tamil political parties that is also in the process of preparing a set of proposals incorporating a political solution to the ethnic issue to hand over to the government.
General Secretary of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Hassan Ali has told the media that the alliance will work together to formulate a solution.
The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) has also said that it was supportive of such an alliance.
ColomboPage - Recent 10 Stories

event_or_fact.property: the alliance will work together to formulate a solution.
General Secretary, Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC)

description.hltext_display: At least 27 successful applications for new supermarkets have been made by the so-called "big four" in Greater Manchester in the past two years.
description.content:
The BBC contacted every UK planning authority to discover how many shops from Asda, Morrisons, Sainsbury's and Tesco received permission.
The highest number of approvals were in Manchester with seven between November 2008 and November 2010.
Across the North West, at least 63 were approved, with a further 10 pending.
The figures were obtained by researchers examining the expansion of Tesco, Asda, Sainsbury's and Morrisons across the UK.
Tesco appears to dominate the Greater Manchester supermarket landscape, with its stores accounting for 22 of the recent successful applications.
The planning regulations need to be looked at in relation to this because they are basically exploiting a weakness in planning law One of its most recent Tesco Express stores opened inside a derelict pub in Barlow Moor Road in the Manchester suburb of Chorlton.
Campaigners from the Keep Chorlton Interesting group, who had fought a long battle against another store less than one mile away, became aware it was opening when the signs went up.
It did not need planning approval because a change of use from a pub to a shop is considered "permitted development" under planning regulations.
An application submitted by a management company to add doors, windows and disabled access ramps was approved in February, but the Tesco name was not included.
Campaign spokesperson Debbie Ellen said: "The thing that bothers me is that it is possible for them to basically turn pubs all over the country into supermarkets without any proper process of consultation with the local community. "I think the planning regulations need to be looked at in relation to this because they are basically exploiting a weakness in planning law." About four miles away in Manchester city centre, concerns have also been raised about another Tesco store which has opened in a former nightclub.
The 1,300-capacity Jilly's Rock World was a mecca for rock fans looking for live music in the city centre throughout the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
Planning approval was granted in September following an application made by a consultancy firm. Tesco was not named in the initial form.
Liberal Democrat councillor Marc Ramsbottom is opposed to the store because of what he sees as a proliferation of small supermarkets across the city centre.
But Mr Ramsbottom can only voice his concern at the licensing hearing because the councillor - who represents the city centre ward - was not aware of the planning decision. "Whilst some of them are obviously clearly very good, they're well-used by residents, what they do is squeeze out a lot of the independents," he told the BBC. "We don't have very many independent food stores [and] delis operating. We have had them in the past in Manchester but they've just gone out of business. They can't survive against the weight of some of these massive corporations. "I'm not against per se having Tesco, Sainsbury's and the like in city centres. I think they are very useful, very valuable and contribute to the high street. "But when they dominate to the extent that they do, it becomes monopolistic and it just squeezes out everyone else." According to Ms Ellen, the success of local campaigns in slowing down supermarket applications means they are becoming even harder to oppose. She said: "It doesn't matter how vigilant local groups are in relation to trying to oppose this kind of development, if the application isn't transparent in terms of who is putting in an application how are you ever going to stop this kind of thing? "You can't because it's over before you even know about it... I think there is a definite pattern of Tesco - and other outlets - doing that." In response, the company said: "Most of our new store applications are not for large supermarkets but for small, local convenience stores, the likes of which millions of customers have relied on to get food in the bad weather." It added: "We have invested in the UK even during the worst recession in living memory, creating tens of thousands of jobs, many in the most deprived areas of the country."
