Grid-Tools Ltd: Huw Price Awarded "IT Director of the Year" by QA Guild
description.author: General News UK
description.content:
General News UK
Huw Price, co-owner and managing director of Grid-Tools, has been named âIT Director of the Yearâ by QAGuild, the international software testing community.
QAGuild were impressed with Priceâs ability to re-define the way organizations go about provisioning data for testing and development. They also commented on the advancements that Grid-Tools have made in the last six years with Huw at the helm.
The Oxford based company also picked up QAGuildâs âMost Innovative Testing Tool Choice for 2011.â Both awards were given in recognition of Grid-Toolsâ success and achievement this year in the field of research and development.
Grid-Tools also won the âUK IT Achievement of the Yearâ award at the UK IT Industry Awards earlier this month bringing their tally for the year to three. âIt was an honour to accept the award for IT Director of the Year,â said Price, âbut it is the dedication to innovation from every member of our company that has made this a breakthrough year.â
About Grid-Tools Ltd
Grid-Tools is known internationally as the industry leader in data creation, data masking and test data management tools and solutions. Their highly experienced personnel have been writing and developing solutions for large companies in both the private and public sectors for over 30 years.
The Grid-Tools Datamakerâ¢ suite includes a wide range of technologically advanced tools for test data management. Their signature solution, GT Datamakerâ¢, is a revolutionary tool that creates and publishes quality test data from scratch whilst maintaining the relationships and referential integrity of production environments. Cutting-edge and groundbreaking in nature, Datamakerâ¢ offers three methods for managing and generating data for testing and development: database subsetting, data masking and data creation. Datamakerâ¢ also offers end-to-end manageability and enhancement of test data in multiple formats.
The Grid-Tools methodology consists of using a âdata-centricâ approach to test data management. Their focus is to ensure the quality of the test data you are using is of the right quality for successful testing and development.
For more information, please visit: www.grid-tools.com or call UK: +44 (0) 1865 884 600 or USA: 1-866-563-3120

I mÃ¥nga Ã¥r har fÃ¶rra kommunalrÃ¥det Jan Anders Palmqvist vurmat fÃ¶r hÃ¥llbar utveckling och ambitionen att gÃ¶ra Ronneby till en attraktiv kommun med detta fokus tycks nu skjuta fart. Jordens resurser Ã¤r inte oÃ¤ndliga och mÃ¤nniskan mÃ¥ste fÃ¶rstÃ¥ att hon sjÃ¤lv skall bidra till hÃ¥llbar utveckling, sÃ¤ger Jan Anders Palmqvist.
Reserver finansierar
Med hjÃ¤lp av obeskattade reserver i det kommunala bolaget MiljÃ¶teknik skall det nu satsas pÃ¥ ett forsknings och utvecklingscenter runt dessa frÃ¥gor. Exakt innehÃ¥ll Ã¤r inte bestÃ¤mt - Vi mÃ¥ste ta hÃ¤nsyn till nÃ¤ringslivets behov sÃ¤ger Roger Fredriksson.
Johan Sandberg (fp) tidigare vd fÃ¶r UIQ kÃ¤nner nÃ¤ringslivet vÃ¤l och Ã¤r nÃ¥got av projektledare i riggningen av projektet. Att just denna akademi Ã¤r inblandad beror mycket pÃ¥ deras forskning i materiallÃ¤ra och polymerteknik sÃ¤ger Johan Sandberg.
Att projektet nu tar fart beror pÃ¥ att fÃ¶retagen i Ronneby har trÃ¤ffats och uttryckt Ã¶nskemÃ¥l. SÃ¶lve LandÃ©n ansvarig fÃ¶r KunskapskÃ¤llan, Ronnebys LÃ¤rcenter, kommer att bistÃ¥ med utbildningssamordningen.
Det fÃ¶r Blekinge sÃ¥ unika att socialdemokrater och moderater tycks helt eniga borgar fÃ¶r att det hÃ¤r kommer att bli en lyckad satsning, inte bara fÃ¶r Ronneby utan fÃ¶r hela lÃ¤net. Lite av Ronnebys revansch efter akademins nesliga sorti.

description.hltext_display: CICS: CICS Verifies Icelandairâs Emissions for EU ETS
description.author: General News UK
description.content:
CICS is chosen by Icelandair to Verify its Emissions for the EU Emissions Trading Scheme
CICS (Complete Integrated Certification Services Ltd) is pleased to announce that it has been chosen by Icelandair, the prestigious flag carrier airline of Iceland, to independently verify its emissions data for the EU Emissions Trading Scheme. Aviation has been included in EU ETS since January 2010 with the first verified reports having to be submitted by the fast-approaching deadline of 31 March 2011.
Icelandair aims to be both the preferred airline to and from Iceland and an attractive choice for North Atlantic travel, and is committed to providing safe and efficient air travel and unique services. As part of its Environmental Policy, Icelandair offers all of its passengers the chance to offset their flights through the Iceland Carbon Fund.
Shaun Bainbridge, Sales Director at CICS, says: âWe are delighted to be working with Icelandair to provide verification of their emissions data. Having verified $8 billion worth of CO2 to date, our knowledge of the directive is unrivalled, ensuring that our clients achieve complete compliance with the regulations.â
"We feel it is important to use the experience of CICS for the verification process to strengthen the integrity of the emissions trading program and our participation in it," says Hilmar Baldurrson, Icelandair VP Flight Operations.
For more information about CICS visit www.cicsglobal.com/aviation.
About CICS
Complete Integrated Certification Services Ltd (CICS) is a leading accredited greenhouse gas verifier in Europe and North America, and was the first body to be accredited under the EU ETS Phase II (2008 â 2012). CICS verifies over 40% of the operators reporting into the UK and Irish Environmental Agencies. Previous work in the aviation sector has included independently verifying carbon emissions for several major international airlines to support their offset programmes and EU ETS pre-verification. CICS verifiers are aviation trained (IATA).
Contact Information
Complete Integrated Certification Services Ltd

description.hltext_display: How to Take Advantage of Special Las Vegas Hotel Discounts and Deals
description.content: Unless you're a frequent traveler to Las Vegas, it can be quite tedious to find the best deals for your hotel stay. With hotel prices fluctuating every day, it doesn't hurt to check before you book a room. If you haven't been to Las Vegas in many years, a lot could have changed or updated including: hotel renovations, casino additions, new swimming pools, new shows, bars, night clubs and more. In fact, many hotels are much more competitively priced, constantly creating hotel deals and special package to encourage visitors.Some advice to help you take advantage of these hotel deals and special packages in Vegas:â¢ Continuously check online for new deals or discounts. In the end, hotels are a business and that means, when they have excess hotel rooms they want to sell (fill) them as fast as they can. Empty hotel rooms means they are losing money. The huge hotels, like Harrah and MGM Grand are constantly creating and marketing promotions and hotel deals. They will give incentives to get you stay at their hotel, whether that is free meals, gambling money, or discounted rooms. Other perks may include show tickets or airfare packages. Why pay for full price for a hotels room, when you don't have to. Being an informed buyer can save you a lot of money and give you more to spend in the casino.â¢ Read all the details for the hotel specials. Third party websites, depending on where you go, might not list every detail. It doesn't hurt to double check before you book. Does one promotion code contain more than another site? Some deals are only for a certain amount time and only certain days. Based on availability the hotel will generate price discounts until they fill the desired amount of room. After that the offer will be expired.â¢ Read as many online hotel reviews as possible from different review websites. There are many ways to rate and review a hotel. Some common attributes that make or break a stay include: the location of room in relation to other places of interest, price, room size, internet access, food availability, room service, room cleanliness and customer service. This should help you judge what hotel you should stay at based on consumer reviews.If you're looking to have a good time in Vegas, try staying at a different hotel than you normally would. With all of that said, when you get to Vegas, don't forget to enjoy yourself!

description.content:
SaarbrÃ¼cken (dapd). Angesichts der wachsenden Zahl von Hautkrebserkrankungen in Deutschland will die Bundesregierung offenbar erneut die Regeln fÃ¼r Sonnenstudios verschÃ¤rfen. Wie die SaarbrÃ¼cker Zeitung berichtet, mÃ¼sse kÃ¼nftig in Sonnenstudios geschultes Personal anwesend sein, was einem Verbot der sogenannten Selbstbedienungs-Studios gleichkomme.
Der Bund will Sonnenstudios stÃ¤rker
regulieren. Foto: ddp AuÃerdem werden Warnhinweise Ã¼ber die Risiken von zu viel UV-Strahlung Pflicht. Das geht aus einem Verordnungsentwurf des Bundesumweltministeriums hervor, der der Zeitung vorliegt. Danach sei auch geplant, fÃ¼r AltgerÃ¤te eine maximale BestrahlungsstÃ¤rke vorzugeben, sodass 90 Prozent der SolarbÃ¤nke ausgetauscht oder umgerÃ¼stet werden mÃ¼ssen.
Nach aktuellen SchÃ¤tzungen der Regierung gibt es in Deutschland etwa 4.000 Studios mit durchschnittlich sieben SonnenbÃ¤nken. Hinzu kommen noch Tausende GerÃ¤te in Hotels, SchwimmbÃ¤dern, Kosmetik- und Fitnessstudios, insgesamt rund 45.000. Die Zahl der Hautkrebsneuerkrankungen habe sich in den vergangenen zehn bis 15 Jahren ungefÃ¤hr verdoppelt, heiÃt es in dem Entwurf. In keinem anderen Land werde kÃ¼nstliche UV-Strahlung so hÃ¤ufig genutzt wie in Deutschland. Erst im vergangenen Jahr war der Besuch eines Sonnenstudios fÃ¼r Jugendliche unter 18 Jahren verboten worden.

description.hltext_display: Crude oil remains around $90.00
description.content:
FXstreet.com (Barcelona) - Crude futures extend past days upside momentum, touching past $90.00 a barrel over Asia for the first time in 2-weeks. The front-month contract remains around that mark in the initial hour over Europe, currently quoting at $90.03 a barrel where it is slightly up from opening price.
Crude has found support as of recent by frigid weather conditions over the majority of Europe and the US, leading to high heating and thus energy demand. Whatâs more, a lightly improved risk appetite buoys the price of crude as geopolitical tensions in the Koreas ease and China avows support to the European debt situation.
With thin volume due to the upcoming holidays keeping volatility low, commodity traders still in the market will have an eye out for todayâs GDP figures from both the US and UK in an effort to gauge recovery. Whatâs more, investors will focus in on supply as the EIA reports stock changes later in the day.

description.hltext_display: How to Make a Stress-Free Travel
description.content:
when you decide to go for business or pleasure, traveling can be very stressful. The stressed of planning to start when you leave. However, stress is not your business trip or vacation ruined. Here are some simple tips are guaranteed to you that the stress of the journey to get rid of errors.
Plan
There is no alternate for good planning. To ensure that your journey is stress free, make sure your flight and hotel accommodation is booked and confirmed. This will be reassuring to know that the delays are unlikely and there will be no surprises at the reception.
If transportation during your trip, the better. If you need to get around the city by taxi, you should ask the concierge to help you, a reputable taxi company.
Keep a journal
Write your experiences during the trip will not only preserves the memories, will also help to reduce stress. Describe the sights you've seen, places you have, even people you've met. Take small souvenir from each experience, a napkin from the restaurant where you eat a receipt from a souvenir shop, a bus ticket going somewhere special. This keeps the magic of the journey with you.
Keep an open communication
Nothing can better stress buster than staying in touch with family on the road. With current technology, communication is always more available. People can travel and stay in touch with cell phones, e-mails and text messages. Prices in international telephone calls are also cheaper.
Reward yourself
Do not hesitate. When on a business trip, make sure that all your work for you to go sightseeing. Plan one day where everything is to do what can lead to various tourist attractions in the city. You only have to broadcast, make sure you have enough time to go anywhere. It will also help to see that from a post route. You can always ask the hotel to help you.
Eat local food
Food can reduce travel stress! Yes, enjoy local food and stay away from the usual staple of burger, spaghetti and cola. Before leaving, so you can people who traveled the country if they can advise restaurants. Hotel staff can also help greatly. If you're there, do not hesitate to ask for special home and enjoy!
Be prepared to get lost
Remember that you are a foreign country and have traveled there several times, do not know how. Be lost is probably the biggest nightmare for travelers.
Before the trip, buy a travel book with maps and some useful phrases you can use with the locals or read some post from travel blog. Carry yourself with a credit card, identification papers and enough money to move, if you get lost. It also shows a good idea in a hotel for a business card, you can request if you ask locals for directions.
Recognizing that you lost, you better prepare for and ready for anything.

description.hltext_display: Browns place two on IR
description.content: Berea, OH (Sports Network) - The Cleveland Browns placed linebacker Scott Fujita and cornerback Eric Wright on injured reserve Tuesday. Fujita has been out since November 14 when he strained a left knee ligament against the New York Jets. Signed as a free agent in March, he finished his ninth season in the NFL with 51 tackles, 3 1/2 sacks and an interception. Wright hurt his left knee this past Sunday in the 19-17 loss at Cincinnati. He began the season as a starter, but lost that job to rookie Joe Haden after getting beat for several touchdowns. He totaled 42 tackles and an interception along with nine passes defensed in his fourth season. To fill the roster spots, the Browns signed nose tackle Travis Ivey off the practice squad and free agent linebacker Steve Octavien. Also, the team signed fullback Tyler Clutts to the practice squad.

description.hltext_display: [$] Sounds of the season
Â¡Feliz AÃ±o Nuevo, que ya viene Navidad!
description.content:
La instalaciÃ³n en el Kremlin de un abeto centenario marcÃ³ ayer el comienzo de los preparativos del AÃ±o Nuevo en Rusia, que, a diferencia de Occidente, celebrarÃ¡ la Navidad ya en 2011.
"Quiero que (el Ã¡rbol) brille mucho, y por eso he hecho unas estrellas. Pero necesitaremos a muchos niÃ±os para adornar bien este abeto gigante", dijo a Efe Natasha, una niÃ±a de 8 aÃ±os que acudiÃ³ al Kremlin para colocar su adorno de papel.
En la plaza de las Catedrales del Kremlin, el corazÃ³n histÃ³rico y polÃ­tico del paÃ­s, una multitud de escolares coloca en las ramas del Ã¡rbol navideÃ±o adornos artesanales al tiempo que varios operarios instalan mÃ¡s de mil metros de luminosas guirnaldas tricolores, en honor a la bandera patria.
En sus caras, la ilusiÃ³n de un niÃ±o a la espera de los regalos del entraÃ±able Ded Moroz, o "Abuelo FrÃ­o", considerado la versiÃ³n eslava de los archiconocidos Santa Claus y PapÃ¡ Noel y que siempre viaja acompaÃ±ado de su nieta SnegÃºrochka (Nievecilla).
"Mi mamÃ¡ me ayudÃ³ a hacer un farolillo para adornar el abeto. Quiero que Ded Moroz lo encuentre bien bonito cuando pase a dejar los regalos", confesÃ³ Dmitri, de seis aÃ±os, quien tambiÃ©n quiso engalanar el abeto de mÃ¡s de 30 metros.
Junto a las decoraciones que aportaron los niÃ±os, el abeto contarÃ¡ con 400 nuevos adornos en forma de lazos y estrellas, que se sumarÃ¡n a los ya utilizados en aÃ±os anteriores.
En total, un equipo de quince personas trabajarÃ¡ durante dos dÃ­as en la ornamentaciÃ³n del abeto, que por primera vez se vuelve ecolÃ³gico y consumirÃ¡ la mitad de la electricidad del aÃ±o pasado gracias al uso de bombillas LED.
Queda asÃ­ alterado el paisaje compuesto por las coloristas cÃºpulas de las catedrales ortodoxas de la fortaleza del Kremlin, entre las que ahora resurge la estrella de cuatro puntas que corona el anciano abeto.
El popular Ã¡rbol no se ha librado de las nevadas invernales y un manto blanco cubre ya parte de las ramas de este ejemplar, talado para la ocasiÃ³n.
Por un antojo del calendario, los rusos dan la bienvenida a la Navidad tras la Nochevieja, velada en que el Ã¡rbol cobra protagonismo por ser el lugar predilecto de Ded Moroz para dejar los regalos propios de estas fechas.
Tras la revoluciÃ³n bolchevique de 1917, la Iglesia Ortodoxa Rusa a diferencia del Estado- se negÃ³ a abandonar el hasta entonces utilizado calendario juliano, retrasado trece dÃ­as respecto al gregoriano, con lo que la Nochebuena y la Navidad se desplazaron hasta el 6 y 7 de enero, respectivamente.
Los rusos, fieles a su tradiciÃ³n de tirar la casa por la ventana para recibir el AÃ±o Nuevo, celebrarÃ¡n la llegada de 2011 con diez dÃ­as de fiesta, en los que casi todos los negocios cuelgan el cerrado por vacaciones.
Durante esos dÃ­as la prensa no sale, sÃ³lo hay mÃ©dicos de guardia y servicios mÃ­nimos en los transportes de las grandes ciudades como San Petersburgo o MoscÃº, donde conviven mÃ¡s de diez millones de personas.
Desde que los rusos abandonaran el comunismo y abrazaran el capitalismo, es difÃ­cil encontrar un comercio sin rastro de ornamentos navideÃ±os que inviten al consumismo en su mÃ¡xima esencia.
Ante estos diez dÃ­as de descanso, los rusos parecen haber encontrado una soluciÃ³n: escapar del paÃ­s.
Cada vez son mÃ¡s las familias que aprovechan el parÃ³n vacacional para huir del frÃ­o y disfrutar del clima templado y el mar de destinos como Egipto o TurquÃ­a.
MoscÃº se convierte asÃ­ cada comienzo de aÃ±o en territorio fantasma, en el que sÃ³lo los fieles se dejan ver para asistir a los oficios religiosos en las iglesias de MoscÃº.
De todas maneras, algunos empedernidos moscovitas prefieren permanecer en la capital rusa durante esos dÃ­as, los Ãºnicos del aÃ±o en que se puede circular sin los interminables atascos y disfrutar de la belleza de la que algunos consideran una ciudad de cuento.
Y es que es en los primeros diez dÃ­as del aÃ±o cuando se ensalzan los contrastes entre el gris de la arquitectura estalinista y lo ostentoso de las cerca de 800 iglesias ortodoxas que brotan cual cebollas invertidas del asfalto de la ciudad.
Eso sÃ­ que es un buen regalo de Navidad.

description.hltext_display: Life is a Beach on Chaweng Beach
description.content:
If you've heard the phrase 'life's a beach' then it couldn't fit anywhere more than Chaweng Beach on the Thai island of Koh Samui. A holiday here stirs up a mood of total delight and the phrase 'life's a beach' is perfect.
Chaweng Beach extends an impressive seven magnificent miles and is located in the north eastern part of Koh Samui. The island's most fashionable tourist quarter means that it is also the most developed and you'll find everything needed for a holiday in the sultry sun - water sports, a broad range of dining opportunities and a lively night scene.
It's very easy to find peace and tranquility here too, away from the busy bars, fast food eateries and souvenir shops you'll discover places of calm without the blare of music and whine of jetski's. Hotels and resorts line the beach but at the north and south ends it's much quieter. South of Chaweng Beach is little Chaweng with just a few hotels and restaurants so if you want somewhere away from the crowded areas then head here.
Beach Road is the main part of Chaweng and the location of most of the popular bars, clubs, restaurants, and shops. During the day the heat gives the area a sleepy feel however as soon as the sun goes down it's transformation into a gratification zone is like magic. Have a coffee at Starbucks or eat at a simple roadside food stall, take a walk around the streets and soak up the buzz, or go clubbing - the choices are limitless.
Shopping for souvenirs is also good on the Beach Road and you can find t-shirts, inexpensive jewellery and other bits and pieces such as soap carvings, hippy-style bags, shoes and hats. Tailors from the sub-continent hustle for trade and offer to make you a suit in a day.
Returning to the beach the swimming is ideal as the water is warm and calm, sunbathe on a sun lounger and sample fresh coconut juice, the vendors will hew them open there and then, simply add a straw and let the sweetness quench your thirst.
Also on the beach are masseuse offering the ultimate relaxation with oil and foot massages, they walk the beach offering their services either under the shaded trees or right there on your sunlounger, always agree a price beforehand.
There are hawkers selling all sorts of goods and services on the beach, from ice cream and a cold beer, hair braiding and henna tattoos, there's no need to move from your chair as they'll come to you.
For the more energetic amongst you then why not have a go at jet-skiing, take a banana boat ride, or go water skiing, windsurfing or parasailing. Or the more ambitious might like to attend diving school and learn scuba from qualified instructors, or try your hand at Thai boxing if you have the courage.
The scope of Koh Samui hotels in Chaweng is broad offering everything from basic beachside huts to luxurious 5 star resorts, these days boutique hotels are a popular choice for their unique style of interior decoration and quality of personal service, and spa resorts which offer an array of spa and beauty packages combined with sumptuous lodgings.
Some mourn the changes in Chaweng from the original sleepy cove to the present day busy holiday-maker town, however the fact remains that tourists need facilities and Samui can provide these. There is everything here you could possibly want for a great holiday and the island is quick and convenient to reach by ferry or airplane.

description.content: BY SAM SLAUGHTER Staff Writer Harnessing the gift-giving season, Riedel, the wine glass company, brought eager wine tasters the gift of good wine and better glasses on Dec. 15. read more

description.hltext_display: Independent probe for Cameron Highlands bus crash
description.content:
PUTRAJAYA, Dec 22 â The Cabinet today decided that an independent board of inquiry be set up to investigate Mondayâs Cameron Highlands bus crash which killed 27 people, Transport Minister Datuk Seri Kong Cho Ha said.
He said the board would also look into the overall structure of commercial vehicle operations.
The chairman and members of the board would be appointed after the ministry sought the advice of the Attorney-Generalâs Chambers, he told reporters at his office here.
Kong said the prime minister was saddened by the incident and the Cabinet was âvery concernedâ.
Twenty-five Thai tourists and the Malaysian driver and tourist guide were killed when a double-decker bus coming down from Cameron Highlands crashed onto the divider and overturned at Km15 of the Cameron Highlands-Simpang Pulai Road in what is regarded as the worst road accident in Malaysian history. â Bernama

description.hltext_display: Kays: Natural Living: The Latest Home Design Trends For Autumn And Winter
description.author: General News UK
description.content:
There are a number of new design trends that families can use to spruce up their homes this year. Following the move towards greener living, the current home design trends for autumn and winter are based on natural, earthy tones inspired by the changing seasons.
It is often said that a home is significantly more than just four walls and a roof; it is a place where families come together and where memories are made. A home should therefore be a warm and inviting space, it should be personalised and meaningful to those who inhabit it. One of the best ways to achieve this home design balance is by choosing a decorating theme that reflects the homeownerâs character and needs.
Effective themes are simple in design, with the most convincing being based on a particular colour, style or destination. This year, the most versatile colours to use when decorating a room are rich autumn shades of gold, bronze and red, which help create a warm atmosphere when combined with lighter or darker tones of white, black or grey.
The chosen theme and colour palette should also ideally reflect the ambience of a particular room. For example, a bedroom is a private space to which people can retreat to relax and unwind. Therefore the most important factors to consider when deciding on home design trends for bedrooms are comfort and style. Consider matching the tieback curtains andÂ bed linen, while using throw pillows and rugs to add either a bit of colour or a vibrant pattern to the room.
Symmetry is also a very effective home design tool, especially for people who prefer order. Matching bedside lamps and well positioned mirrors, canvases and other wall art are all useful for creating an organised and tranquil environment, while the choice in lampshades, frames and artwork will allow for personal touches that establish a more homely, lived-in feel.
Visit Kaysâ online store for more of the latest natural home design trends, including the Autumn Gold and Red Hot themed collections ofÂ bedroom furniture and accessories.

description.hltext_display: Honeymoon Magic: Filling Holidays in Bali With Romance and Bliss
description.content:
Edit Article | Posted: Dec 21, 2010 |Comments: 0 |
Share
If there's one occasion that needs as much romance and bliss as possible, it's the honeymoon. This special event has long become one of the most treasured and cherished moments in a couple's relationship. Whether celebrating the bond between newlyweds or rekindling the flame between long-time partners, a honeymoon is as important and momentous as any other relationship landmark.
To ensure a honeymoon that's truly unforgettable, it's essential to choose the right setting that perfectly matches the meaning and feel of such an occasion. After all, honeymoons typically happen only a few times in a person's life. Therefore, each one should be as grand and special as it can be.
With all the aspects to consider for a perfect honeymoon, it would be difficult to go wrong with one that takes place in a villa in Seminyak, Bali, Indonesia. As one of the country's most significant islands, Bali has gained world-wide popularity for its amazing natural attractions and strong cultural heritage. With a place as naturally rich and diverse as Bali, spending the honeymoon here would be an easy choice.
Among the many vibrant regions in the island, it's best to choose one that suits the characteristics and requirements of a honeymoon. With the emergence of high-end attractions like hotels, spas, and commercial establishments, Seminyak looks to be a prime setting for such an occasion. Here, amid all the natural wonders of Bali, you'll enjoy plenty of opportunities to enjoy the high-quality lifestyle reminiscent of movie-style honeymoons.
But for all intents and purposes, a honeymoon should also be private and intimate. After all, this is a uniquely special occasion focusing on partners and their time together. With that in mind, guests should choose one of the many hotels in Seminyak that offers the intimacy and romantic feel that a honeymoon requires. Hotels like the four-star Puri Saron Hotel Seminyak, for example, provide the ideal setting for such a celebration. With a sublime natural setting and lavish rooms and villas in Seminyak, blissful moments are all but guaranteed here.
Like any other accommodation, it would be best to book the honeymoon stay in advance in order to avail special discounts or packages. For instance, Puri Saron Hotel Seminyak, currently has 5 special honeymoon packages applicable from December 22, 2010 to December 31, 2011. Their packages includes a stay of at least 2 nights at the hotel, along with a handful of other features like a romantic dinner, room decoration, 2 hours of aromatherapy, daily afternoon tea, honeymoon gift, and many more. Package rates start at USD415.00.
Just like any other special occasion in life, it's ideal to make the honeymoon as unforgettable as possible. Seminyak in Bali, with its numerous wonderful sights and sounds, would serve as a perfect setting for such a grand event. It's undoubtedly intimate, breathtaking, and romantic, just like a honeymoon should be.
Â
About Puri Saron Hotel Seminyak
Puri Saron Hotel Seminyak is a four-star hotel in Seminyak, Bali, Indonesia characterized by its truly beautiful atmosphere and top-notch facilities and services. With exquisite accommodations and features like a beach, spa, and high-quality restaurants, it's no wonder why guests choose to stay at this hotel whenever they travel to Seminyak. For more information on this hotel and the honeymoon packages mentioned earlier, please visit http://www.purisaronhotel.com/seminyak/ .

description.hltext_display: Ramsauer rÃ¤umt Defizite bei der Bahn ein
description.content:
Berlin (dpa). Bundesverkehrsminister Peter Ramsauer (CSU) hat angesichts der aktuellen Verkehrsprobleme jahrelange VersÃ¤umnisse bei der Bahn eingerÃ¤umt. Wir haben mit erheblichen technischen Problemen zu kÃ¤mpfen, die aus der Vergangenheit herrÃ¼hren, sagte der CSU- Politiker am Mittwoch im ARD-Morgenmagazin.
In den letzten zehn Jahren sei zudem an der sogenannten Bereithaltung gespart worden. Es macht sich jetzt bemerkbar, dass man geglaubt hat, man kÃ¶nne sich das eine oder andere an der Reserve sparen. Diese baue man zurzeit in allen Bereichen der Bahn wieder auf. Die Probleme lieÃen sich nicht von heute auf morgen beheben. Aber die Ãffentlichkeit kann erwarten, dass die Politik zusammen mit den einzelnen VerkehrstrÃ¤gern alles daran setzt, dass die Dinge in Ordnung gebracht werden - und das tun wir.
Ramsauer wies VorwÃ¼rfe zurÃ¼ck, dass die Winterreifenpflicht den Lastwagenverkehr nicht ausreichend einschlieÃe. NatÃ¼rlich mÃ¼ssten nicht nur die Antriebsachsen, sondern alle Achsen eines Lastwagens mit griffigen Allwetter- und Ganzjahresreifen ausgestattet sein. Jeder Lastwagen, der auf den anderen Achsen nicht hinreichend bereift ist, wird sofort aus dem Verkehr gezogen, sagte der Verkehrsminister.

description.hltext_display: International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA): The Fertilizer Industry Has Invested US$40 Billion in Additional Capacity Since the Food Crisis In 2008
description.author: General News UK
description.content:
Today the International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA) released to the public its short-term Fertilizer Outlook 2010-2011. The report warns of rising agricultural commodity and food prices, as seen just before the food crisis of 2007/08. It also describes the global fertilizer industry's response to the challenge of increasing agricultural productivity worldwide. IFA estimates that the industry has invested some US$40 billion in new capacity for the three main nutrients (nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium) in North Africa; West, South and East Asia; and North and South America.
Today theÂ International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA) released to the public its short-term Fertilizer Outlook 2010-2011. The report warns of rising agricultural commodity and food prices, as seen just before the food crisis of 2007/08. It also describes the global fertilizer industry's response to the challenge of increasing agricultural productivity worldwide. IFA estimates that the industry has invested some US$40 billion in new capacity for the three main nutrients (nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium) in North Africa; West, South and East Asia; and North and South America.
The economic recovery in 2010 was experienced in agricultural markets, with a rebound of agricultural commodity utilization and prices. A number of factors have contributed to an upward evolution of crop prices. The first is the heat wave that caused poor cereal harvests in the Commonwealth of Independent states (CIS), including extensive fire damage in Russia, as well as the hot and wet conditions in the Corn Belt of the United States. Second, the grain export restrictions currently in effect in Russia and Ukraine are likely to be maintained until June 2011. Third, demand for ethanol, particularly in the United States, remains high, putting pressure on grain markets. Fourth, the cereal stock-to-use ratio is declining to worrying levels, with a significant drop in maize and wheat inventories.
âAnother food crisis could be looming,â says Patrick Heffer, Director of IFAâs Agriculture Service. âThe combination of the weather, trade restrictions, bioenergy growth and low stocks takes us back to three years ago, when food prices spiralled. Based on the data we have analyzed, we are witnessing a situation very similar to what happened in the second half of 2007, with all agricultural prices going up. Today even cotton and sugar prices are high.â
Following a massive decline in fertilizer sales and consumption last year, the speed and extent of the recovery in the first half of 2010 surprised most analysts leading to an annual increase of 13% and 7% over 2009, respectively. IFA is projecting growth in global fertilizer consumption of 4.7% for 2010/2011 and 3.8% for 2011/12. By 2011/12, nutrient application rates would then have fully recovered to the levels seen prior to the economic crisis of 2008.
On the supply side, the rebound in global demand and the near-empty distribution channels at the beginning of the year triggered a strong sales increase and subsequent rising operating rates for all nutrients and raw materials. However, the fertilizer industry will be able to absorb the incremental demand for food, feed, fiber and energy production thanks to the significant investments it has made. The industry has learned the lessons of the previous food crisis and is undertaking extensive development projects in order to play its role as a key driver of sustainable agricultural intensification and improved food security. New or expansion projects are underway for:
ammonia in Algeria, Egypt, Iran, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Trinidad
urea in Algeria, China, Egypt, India, Iran, Pakistan, Qatar and Russia
phosphate in China, Bangladesh, Brazil, Jordan, Morocco, Saudi Arabia and Tunisia
potassium in Canada, Chile, China, Israel, Jordan and Russia.
Between 2010 and 2015, some 55 urea units, 20 potash expansion projects and 40 processed phosphates facilities are planned for completion worldwide. The industry has spent close to US$40 billion on new capacity for all three major nutrients since 2008. IFA estimates that another US$80 billion will be invested between 2011 and 2015, with the highest levels of production, sales and consumption seen to date occurring in 2011.
âEstablishing new capacity cannot happen overnight,â explains Michel Prudâhomme, Director of IFAâs Production and International Trade Service. âThis is the reason the industry is planning for the future. Greenfield capacity projects take from three to eight years between the start of construction and commercial production. A large-scale fertilizer facility calls for an investment of between 0.5 and 3 billion dollars.â
Global urea capacity is projected to expand by 30% between 2009 and 2014 to 222 Mt. During the same period, world potash and phosphates capacity is forecast to grow by 25% and 31%, respectively.
Parallel with the fertilizer industryâs responsibility to address the growing pressure faced by the agricultural sector worldwide, it believes it has a key role to play in promoting sustainable intensification and product stewardship. IFA members are investing in energy efficiency technology and new products in order to reduce the environmental footprint of their activities. They are also helping farmers make the best use of their products by sharing good agricultural practices. During 2011, IFA forecasts a rebound of sales and robust growth in the sector. Global nutrient sales for all uses are projected to grow by 2-3% in 2011, reaching 220-222 Mt nutrients, with increases of about 3% for nitrogen and phosphate products and up to 5% for potash.
For more information on production, trade and sales conditions in 2010 and prospects for 2011, please consult IFAâs Market Outlook Summary:Â
Media contact:
Ms. Morgane DanielouÂ
Director - Information and Communications
International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA)
Switchboard: +33 1 53 93 05 00
mdanielou(at)fertilizer(dot)org
IFAâs website is:Â http://www.fertilizer.org
Backgrounder
The International Fertilizer Industry Association (IFA) is a not-for-profit trade association representing the global fertilizer industry. IFA member companies represent all activities related to the production and distribution of every type of fertilizer, their raw materials and intermediates. IFA's membership also includes organizations involved in agronomic research and training. IFA has some 525 members in about 85 countries. The global fertilizer industry produces some 170 million tons of fertilizer nutrients annually. These nutrients are used in every corner of the globe to support sustainable agricultural production and food security.
Medium-term and short-term outlook reports are released every year in May/June and November/December. They present an overview of world agriculture and fertilizer demand, as well as the global fertilizer supply and trade situation. Unabridged versions of these reports are accessibly only by IFA members. Summaries of the main findings are made available to the public on the IFA web site (http://www.fertilizer.org).
Note on the cost of greenfield capacity projects:
Construction of a new potash complex, including an underground mine, mill and infrastructure, could cost between US$2 and US$3 billion for a capacity of 2 million tons (Mt). A new ammonia urea complex with a capacity of 1.2 Mt urea could be completed in 36 to 40 months, at a cost ranging from US$1.2 to US$1.5 billion. A 3 Mt phosphate rock mine in Peru was recently completed after three years, at a total cost of US$450 million.

description.hltext_display: Philippine Hospitality - Then and Now
description.content:
Hotel accommodation in the Philippines was quite limited until a surge of building in the late 1970's mounted the city with a number of lavish establishments which many of them were managed by international chains. These chains are incessantly in service until now branching within and across the Philippines. Success of each hotel business creates a historical significance in terms of economic growth, favorable investment and tourism force.Philippine hotels are all subject to grading by the Philippine government and are classified from 5 (five) stars- established downward. The evaluation is based solely on the hotel's facilities or functionalities and is not necessarily an indication of its services and cuisines. More facilities, more amenities and services equal to a higher star or rank. Five star hotels provide all the facilities you would expect in an international class establishment. As the facilities get less, the overall stars get fewer, although even the 1(one) star hotel rooms are air conditioned and with bathroom.
Tariffs generally are in accord with the rating. But there are some places like Subic Bay Freeport Zone and Clark Freeport Zone that, by law, were amended as tax free sectors. These places are not only good fire starters for business investment but also excellent places for leisure or extreme adventures, recreation, shopping and of course, accommodation.
As years go by, new and advanced technologies are being discovered and used eventually. This innovation made good impressions and added more credibility for Philippine hotels. Such evolutions are from manual booking to e-mail booking and e-mail booking to online booking.
Philippines has been very gracious, explicit and helpful in terms of Filipino hospitality and comfort. This makes hotel accommodation in the Philippines to be internationally acclaimed and to be often visited by mostly foreigners or retirees seeking for the best investment spot and comfortable place to stay.
The quality of accommodation that you can get from the hotels in the Philippines is highly recognized by different groups or associations in the hospitality industry. Ranging from the most luxurious down to the very common yet still shows an elegant appeal to our ardent eyes.
Philippine Hospitality- then and now, continuously rising above all realms toward world class service and identifiable competence.

description.hltext_display: 'Groundbreaking' Paperless Eco Comics Announced
description.author: Mohawk Media
description.content: --(PR.com)-- by Mohawk MediaBritish publisher Mohawk Media has today announced Eco Comics, a range of environmentally-friendly, paperless comic books.The first digital comic book from the Eco Comics range available now to download or view online is Heroic High, an adventure set on an island superhero community, written by Chris Bunting and drawn by Kit Wallis.Editor Stuart Buckley says: Paper used in the production of comic books can have a damaging effect on the environment, and paying perhaps the biggest price is the tiger, whose habitat this threatens.As for sustainable forestry, world-leading environmental organisations have criticised its weak regard for social and ecological issues.We believe these downloadable, paperless comics are groundbreaking, having been deliberately designed to have a minimal carbon footprint.The added bonuses for the reader are lower cover prices for the same level of quality entertainment, while knowing that theyre being eco-friendly.To download Eco Comics go to http://www.mohawkmedia.co.uk/ecocomics. Following a quick payment system, you can download or view the comics online in various formats, including a page-flip format. PDFs are also available and can be downloaded to iPad.Buckley continues: Buying Eco Comics only takes minutes. Its much faster and easier than going to a comic book store! We hope Eco Comics is the start of an evolution, taking advantage of the latest technologies to help minimise the impact of comic production on the environment.Eco Comics are available from http://www.mohawkmedia.co.uk/ecocomics.Heroic High is a 25-page paperless comic book, available now at $1.95.###Notes to the Editor*Eco Comics logo available on request*Enquiries: editor@mohawkmedia.co.uk - Tel: +44 (0)7854 772329*About Mohawk Media: Mohawk Media launched in 2008. It has produced the official comic book and graphic novel adventures of Tough Guy and Mr. T. Further information: http://www.mohawkmedia.co.uk & http://blog.mohawkmedia.co.uk/British publisher Mohawk Media has today announced Eco Comics, a range of environmentally-friendly, paperless comic books.

description.hltext_display: India, Russia focus on UN's draft Comprehensive Convention to fight terrorism
description.content:
Reaffirming that international terrorism is a threat to global peace and security, India and Russia on Tuesday called for the early completion of negotiations on the United Nation's draft Comprehensive Convention on International Terrorism.
In a joint communiqui issued after bilateral discussions at Hyderabad House here, both sides reaffirmed the central role of the United Nations in combatting international terrorism.
Recalling the bilateral Moscow Declaration on International Terrorism signed on November 6, 2001 in Moscow, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and Russian President Dmitry Medvedev strongly condemned those who supported terrorism noting that states that aid, abet or shelter terrorists are as guilty of acts of terrorism, as their actual perpetrators.
Both sides also agreed that there is no justification whatsoever for any act of terrorism, and that multi-ethnic democratic countries like India and Russia were especially vulnerable to acts of terrorism which are attacks against the values and freedoms enshrined in their societies.
Both sides reaffirmed the need for all states to combine efforts to vanquish this evil.
They called upon Pakistan to expeditiously bring all the perpetrators, authors and accomplices of the November 2008 Mumbai attacks to justice.
India expressed sympathy for the victims of the terrorist attacks in the Moscow metro stations in March 2010, and expressed support for the Government of the Russian Federation's efforts to eliminate terrorism from Russian soil.
They also expressed concern at the deteriorating security situation in Afghanistan, where successful stabilization will be possible only after the elimination of safe havens and infrastructure for terrorism and violent extremism that are present in Afghanistan and Pakistan.
Both sides also underscored the importance of stepped up action by the International Security Assistance Force in combating production and trafficking of illegal narcotics in Afghanistan.
They welcomed the Afghan Government's policy of reintegrating those individuals who agree to give up violence, adhere to the Afghan constitution and do not have ties with al Qaeda and other terrorist groups.
Both sides highlighted the need for strict observance of the sanctions regime against persons and entities listed by the UNSCR 1267 Sanctions Committee.
Backing India's candidature at the UNSC, President Medvedev said: "Russia considers India to be strong and deserving candidate in UNSC Permanent Seat if decision to expand this organ is taken."(ANI)

event_or_fact.property: states that aid, abet or shelter terrorists are as guilty of acts of terrorism, as their actual perpetrators.
Russia considers India to be strong and deserving candidate in UNSC Permanent Seat if decision to expand this organ is taken.

Erreur ! Des mails partis sans la carte et arrivÃ©s avec une belle croix rouge, des vÅux envoyÃ©s en double, du stress pour respecter la date fatidique du 31 janvier. Bien des complications pour une tÃ¢che si facile Ã rÃ©aliser avec du papier. RÃ©sultat ? Retour au papier lâannÃ©e suivante et aux sÃ©ances dâÃ©criture, de mise sous plis et dâaffranchissement. Il a fallut encore une annÃ©e avant une nouvelle tentative de carte Ã©lectronique, rÃ©ussie cette fois, grÃ¢ce Ã un mode dâemploi dÃ©taillÃ©, testÃ© en amont, plus de communication interne, un tableau de bord et un rÃ©fÃ©rent pour raccompagner tout ce beau monde. Bref, un mini-projet avec toutes ses dimensions.
Quels enseignements pouvons-nous tirer de cette anecdote ?
1) Toute dÃ©matÃ©rialisation, quelle quâelle soit, se caractÃ©rise par un vrai projet. Il nây a pas de Â« petit Â» projet, de projet facile, qui va marcher tout seul. Il ne faut voir que des projets quâil faut prÃ©parer, piloter, encadrer et accompagner.
2) Les projets de dÃ©matÃ©rialisation fonctionnent correctement lorsque ses sponsors en sont convaincus. Sâils doutent, les utilisateurs douteront aussi, car la communication qui aura Ã©tÃ© assurÃ©e sur le projet nâaura pas Ã©tÃ© assez claire, pÃ©dagogique, et vendeuse.
3) Comme pour tout projet novateur, la dÃ©marche dâaccompagnement au changement sâimpose Ã tous les utilisateurs, avec de la communication en amont, de la formation, des supports de rÃ©fÃ©rence et de lâaccompagnement individualisÃ©.
4) LÃ encore, la technique nâest pas un problÃ¨me pour qui a correctement menÃ© son projet. Les outils existent, il faut juste savoir les utiliser de la bonne maniÃ¨re.
En suivant ces quelques conseils vous serez sÃ»r de rÃ©ussir votre premiÃ¨re action de dÃ©matÃ©rialisation de lâannÃ©e 2011 !
Ajouter un commentaire
Votre commentaire
Recopiez les chiffres
MÃ©moriser mes informations pour faciliter mes prochains envois de commentaires.

description.hltext_display: Dansk el-sportsvogn populÃ¦r
description.content:
Verdens hurtigste elektriske sportsvogn Tesla Roadster er ikke bare den bedst sÃ¦lgende elbil i Danmark i 2010.
Tesla Roadster giver samtidig de benzindrevne sportsvogne kamp til stregen og kommer totalt set ind pÃ¥ en tredjeplads, nÃ¥r det gÃ¦lder salget af 2 personers sportsvogne i prisklassen fra 700.000 - 1 million kr. Det meddeler Teslas danske salgsorganisation.
IfÃ¸lge tal fra bilbranchen er der indtil november mÃ¥ned 2010 indregistreret syv nye Tesla Roadsters i Danmark. Og en ottende er ifÃ¸lge Tesla Danmark indregistreret i december.
- Vi forventer en vÃ¦sentlig stigning 2011, siger salgsdirektÃ¸r Esben Pedersen til DR.
OgsÃ¥ "brugte" solgt Han fortÃ¦ller at der er solgt flere biler, end nybilsstatistikken viser. Biler, som har vÃ¦ret indregistreret som demonstrationsvogne tÃ¦ller ikke med.
- En af dem blev sendt til en kunde i Paris i gÃ¥r.
- Kan man fÃ¥ den med vinterdÃ¦k?
- Ja selvfÃ¸lgelig. Og den kÃ¸rer fantastisk pÃ¥ sne. Det skyldes den avancerede Traction Control, som reagerer langt hurtigere end i almindelige biler. Det er derfor den er sÃ¥ populÃ¦r i Norge, hvor vi har solgt 30, siger Esben Pedersen - og skynder sig at tilfÃ¸je, at man selvfÃ¸gleig skal vÃ¦re lige sÃ¥ forsigtig som med alle andre biler, nÃ¥r det er glat.
Teslas salgstal skal ses i det perspektiv, at firmaet indtil 1. juli ikke havde en butik i Danmark. Tesla har i Ã¥rets sidste halvdel optrappet sin tilstedevÃ¦relse i Danmark med Ã¥bningen af et nyt showroom og service center.
Tesla Danmark er firmaets 13. showroom globalt, og butikken i Bredgade i KÃ¸benhavn tjener som skandinavisk hovedsÃ¦de.
Tesla meddeler at der er leveret over 30 biler til det Skandinaviske marked i Ã¥r, og i alt kÃ¸rer der omkring 60 Roadsters pÃ¥ de skandinaviske veje.
Bilen, der har designeren Henrik Fisker som ophav, har sjove data. En elmotor med over 200 Hk leverer et drejningsmoment pÃ¥ 380NM fra fÃ¸rste omdrejning, og det skaber en accelleration fra 0 til 100 km i timen pÃ¥ 4 sekunder.
Top 3 sportsvogne i Danmark 2010: BMW Z4: 9 Stk. Pris fra 703.000 kr. Mercedes SLK: 8 Stk. Pris fra 998.000 kr. Tesla Roadster: 7 Stk. Pris fra 780.000 kr. (til og med november) Tesla og Norske Think er de eneste fabriksproducerede elbiler solgt i Danmark i 2010. Til og med november er der solgt 5 Think.

description.hltext_display: Los cristianos, una reliquia en Tierra Santa
description.content:
Tras dÃ©cadas de migraciones, la comunidad cristiana de Tierra Santa se ha convertido en una minorÃ­a tan exigua que lucha por sobrevivir y mantener vivo el espÃ­ritu de JesÃºs en el lugar de su nacimiento.
Un aÃ±o mÃ¡s y en vÃ­speras navideÃ±as salen a la luz los datos de peregrinos que acudirÃ¡n a los Santos Lugares y en especial a la ciudad cisjordana de BelÃ©n, cuna del cristianismo, pero en contraste con las cifras rÃ©cord que este aÃ±o -cuando se espera la llegada de 90.000 visitantes por Navidad-, los cristianos en Tierra Santa se encuentran reducidos a la mÃ­nima expresiÃ³n.
Una vez concluidos los villancicos y el festivo ambiente navideÃ±o, la comunidad cristiana en Tierra Santa regresarÃ¡ a la difÃ­cil realidad de subsistir como minorÃ­a en territorios diferentes, bajo regÃ­menes administrativos distintos y el influjo de la mayorÃ­a musulmana palestina o la judÃ­a israelÃ­.
"Somos una pequeÃ±a comunidad, una minorÃ­a cristiana, en una masa musulmana y una masa hebrea, pero esperamos que esta presencia sea efectiva y que tenga un impacto positivo sobre la sociedad", declarÃ³ ayer a Efe el Patriarca Latino de JerusalÃ©n, monseÃ±or Fuad Twal.
De acuerdo a datos del Centro Inter Iglesias, apenas 200.000 cristianos viven repartidos en Israel, de los cuales 150.000 son mayormente palestinos o Ã¡rabes con ciudadanÃ­a israelÃ­.
En Cisjordania y Gaza son 60.000, un nÃºmero reducido si se compara con los mÃ¡s de 350.000 cristianos palestinos emigrados que hoy residen en paÃ­ses Ã¡rabes vecinos, incluidos campos de refugiados, EEUU, naciones latinoamericanas como Chile, algunos paÃ­ses nÃ³rdicos europeos, Australia o CanadÃ¡, segÃºn datos de la OLP.
En la ciudad de JerusalÃ©n sÃ³lo 15.400 personas se identifican como cristianos, comparadas con las 31.000 que asÃ­ lo hacÃ­an hace seis dÃ©cadas, en el perÃ­odo del Mandato BritÃ¡nico de Palestina, segÃºn datos difundidos ayer por el Instituto para Estudios de Israel.
SegÃºn ese instituto, la comunidad cristiana en la Ciudad Santa estÃ¡ integrada por 12.800 cristianos Ã¡rabes y 2.600 clÃ©rigos, monjes y emigrantes de ex repÃºblicas soviÃ©ticas.
Si en 1948, aÃ±o del establecimiento del Estado de Israel, los cristianos constituÃ­an el 20 por ciento de la poblaciÃ³n, hoy no llegan a ser el 2 por ciento, y el Ã©xodo continÃºa.
La familia Qumsieh, de la localidad cristiana de Beit Sahur, cerca de BelÃ©n, abandonarÃ¡ la regiÃ³n en breve.
Eman Qumsieh, 48 aÃ±os y madre de familia, explica que la decisiÃ³n familiar de emigrar a EEUU no es nueva.
"Hemos intentado durante la Segunda Intifada poder establecernos en AmÃ©rica. Nuestros padres tienen nacionalidad estadounidense y nos ofrecieron ayuda. Tras ocho aÃ±os, finalmente obtuvimos los papeles y estamos deseando salir de esta prisiÃ³n en la que se ha convertido BelÃ©n", explica al referirse a la claustrofÃ³bica situaciÃ³n desde que hace unos aÃ±os se levantara el muro de separaciÃ³n israelÃ­.
Recuerda cÃ³mo su marido, Munther Qumsieh, de 40 aÃ±os e ingeniero genÃ©tico de profesiÃ³n, ha llegado a vender cafÃ© por las calles de la poblaciÃ³n para traer un jornal a casa.
"El futuro aquÃ­ es incierto. No podemos garantizar que nuestros hijos tengan un futuro. Tampoco vemos salida al proceso polÃ­tico y las disputas internas entre Al-Fatah y HamÃ¡s desmoralizan a nuestro pueblo. Sencillamente, no vemos ninguna otra soluciÃ³n", se lamenta.
Esta palestina cristiana es madre de cuatro hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 24 y los 14 aÃ±os, y relata con orgullo que el mayor ha logrado una beca en EEUU para jugar al fÃºtbol.
"Ha tenido suerte porque allÃ­ aprecian el talento de los jÃ³venes, no como aquÃ­, que continuamos luchando por nuestra propia supervivencia", sostiene.
Eman reconoce, sin embargo, que con su partida la comunidad cristiana seguirÃ¡ menguando.
"Estoy triste porque los cristianos en BelÃ©n constituimos menos del dos por ciento de la poblaciÃ³n y si me voy serÃ© una menos. Con todo, sigo pensando que hay que proteger nuestra religiÃ³n", concluye.

description.hltext_display: Sears back at the Boleyn
description.content:
The Hammers attack has been bolstered by the early return from Scunthorpe of Freddie Sears
Send Print RSS
Freddie Sears has been recalled for the busy Christmas programme at West Ham United.
The 21-year-old striker impressed during a two-month loan spell at Championship side Scunthorpe United and will hope to force his way into Avram Grant's plans with matches to come against Fulham, Everton and Wolverhampton Wanderers between now and New Year's Day. The Hammers also have an FA Cup third-round tie against Barnsley on Saturday 8 January, three days after the league trip to Newcastle United.
Sears has had three loan spells away from the Boleyn Ground, playing at Crystal Palace and Coventry City before Scunthorpe. He was due to rejoin his team-mates for training on Wednesday before Sunday's trip to Fulham. Matthew Fry remains the only Hammer out on loan, with his hugely successful spell at Charlton Athletic continuing until early January.

description.hltext_display: Strong Australian Dollar Raises Concerns
description.content: With all the things happening in Australia, business visa holders are closely watching the latest developments here. With the country being one of the fastest growing economies in the world today, changes in here would certainly have a big effect. Thus, it is not surprising that observers from both in and out of the country are closely looking at the situation.One of the recent events that a lot of economic observers are talking nowadays is the strength being shown by the Australian dollar against other currencies in the last few months. It can be recalled that, since August of this year, the Australian dollar was able to get substantial gains in the foreign exchange market. In fact, one of its biggest gains was in September, where it went almost at par with the US dollar in the trading scene.Many observers are very welcoming of the current trend. According to them, this is a clear indicator that the country is well on the way to recovery after last year's financial crisis. It should be noted that Australia was among the countries that were significantly hit by the crisis. However, observers said that because of the mitigation plan the the Australian government has implemented, the country was able to survive the onslaught of the crisis.In fact, a lot of economic analysts agree that Australia actually came out much stronger after the crisis. They pointed out the growing strength of the Australian dollar as proof. According to them, the growing strength of the Aussie dollar is an indication that more and more investors are becoming confident of the country's market once again.However, some experts warned that the public must not get overexcited with the strength of the Australian dollar just yet. According to them, while the event does sound good, it also has negative consequences that come along with it. One thing they have pointed out is that a rising dollar could also cause product prices to go up, because of the greater value.One of the sectors that they have given as example is the foreign education industry. Here, the increase in dollar value have also increased tuition fee rates. This, in turn, has discourage many foreign students from enrolling and opted to move to other countries. This has resulted in the slump in student numbers that the industry is currently experiencing.

description.hltext_display: Singapura Anjur Persidangan Biofuel Mac Ini
description.content:
SINGAPURA: Akademia, saintis dan pakar-pakar biofuel antarabangsa akan berhimpun di sini pada Mac ini untuk mengenal pasti ruang-ruang yang menjanjikan masa depan yng cerah bagi biofuel yang berdaya maju.
Pakar-pakar itu akan membincangkan pertimbangan ekonomi dan alam sekitar teknologi biofuel dan penyepaduan biofuel dalam prasarana tenaga sedia ada, manakala akademia, kerajaan dan sektor swasta akan membincangkan dan mengulas penyelidikan dan dasar.
Persidangan selama enam hari yang akan bermula pada 1 Mac itu dianjurkan oleh pertubuhan tidak mencari untung yang berpangkalan di Amerika Syarikat, Keystone Symposia on Molecular and Cellular Biology, dan Agensi bagi Teknologi dan Penyelidikan Sains Singapura (A*STAR).
Dalam satu kenyataan pada Rabu, A*STAR berkata persidangan bertajuk "Biofuel"itu akan membincangkan pilihan-pilihan biofuel bagi masa depan yang menjimatkandan mampan, kelestarian etanol selulos (biofuel yang dihasilkan daripada biojisim bukan makanan), biofuel algae (bahan api yang diperoleh daripada algae), pembangunan bahan mentah biojisim dan potensi pengeluaran biojisim di Asia Tenggara.
Antara penceramah yang tersohor di peringkat antarabangsa pada persidanganitu ialah Dr Adam Brown dari Agensi Tenaga Antarabangsa; Professor Timothy Donohue dari University of Wisconsin-Madison/ Great Lakes Bioenergy; Dr Arthur Grossman dari Solazyme Inc; dan Professor Lonnie Ingram dari University of Florida.
Salah seorang penganjur sudut sains persidangan itu, Professor Stephen P. Mayfield dari University of California berkata satu daripada cabaran terbesar yang dihadapi oleh manusia hari ini ialah memajukan proses yang cekap dan mampan untuk menukar tenaga suria menjadi makanan dan biofuel yang diperlukan oleh dunia.
"Tiada satu strategi tenaga boleh diperbaharui yang boleh memberi penyelesaian menyeluruh tetapi gabungan strategi yang boleh diselaraskan dandisepadukan dengan berkesan berpotensi untuk mengurangkan pergantungan kitakepada bahan api fosil dengan ketara," tegasnya.
Kata beliau di saat-saat yang kritikal dalam menyusun strategi baru bagi tenaga global, simposium ini akan membincangkan potensi biotenaga yang dihasilkan daripada selulos dan algae sebagai sebahagian daripada masa depan yang lestari bagi dunia.
Keystone Symposia mengadakan pertemuannya mengenai biofuel tahun lepas di AS.
Maklumat lanjut mengenai persidangan itu boleh didapati di www.keystonesymposia.org/biofuels. - BERNAMA

description.hltext_display: Serie A - L'AJ resuscita, Roma ingrana, bene CantÃ¹
description.content:
2010
Roma vince per la prima volta in stagione due partite consecutive passando a Biella, mentre Milano si aggiudica il derby d'Italia a Bologna e resta seconda dietro Siena, che passeggia a sua volta su Pesaro. CantÃ¹ vince nell'anticipo a Brindisi ed Ã¨ terza in solitaria, complice il ko di Varese
CANADIAN SOLAR BOLOGNA-ARMANI JEANS MILANO 81-94
Serviva una risposta forte dopo la debacle contro il Valencia, e l?Armani Jeans, nel bene o nel male, l?ha data. Con l?acqua alla gola in Eurolega (costretta a vincere in trasferta contro il Panathinaikos), Milano resta nella scia della Montepaschi conquistando un successo corsaro a Bologna nel derby d?Italia per eccellenza: un successo sudato, maturato soltanto nella parte finale del quarto periodo, al termine di una partita emozionante e palpitante che ha visto le due squadre inseguirsi, superarsi, e contro-sorpassarsi a vicenda in piÃ¹ occasioni. Milano comincia malissimo, tirando 4/16 dal campo nel primo quarto con 7 palle perse, svagata, imprecisa e leggera in difesa, con il rientrante Pecherov ancora in evidente ritardo di condizione: la Virtus gioca fluida e sciolta in attacco e il +10 al primo intervallo (19-9) Ã¨ tutto meritato. L?AJ mette la testa sulla partita nel secondo periodo, partendo dalla difesa, con Rocca ad aumentare il livello nel verniciato: nell?altra metacampo, invece, comincia a mettersi al lavoro Hawkins, che riceve una mano importante da un Melli di grande impatto e da un Jaaber decisamente piÃ¹ guardabile di un Finley estremamente opaco. Il Falco riporta l?AJ sul -4, e sarÃ poi Melli, con 5 punti consecutivi, a firmare il -2 all?intervallo (30-28). Van Den Spiegel, schierato negli ultimi due minuti del quarto, convince Bucchi, e il coach biancorosso parte con il belga sotto canestro nella ripresa: Milano comincia con un parziale di 7-0 e prova a scappare con le triple di Mordente, letale dall?arco. L?AJ tocca il +7 e il +6 in due occasioni, ma prima Amoroso, infuocato in post, poi Poeta, bravo nel leggere bene i cambi difensivi sistematici e ad andare spesso in lunetta per il bonus speso molto presto da Milano, e infine Winston (tripla assurda da 10 metri sulla sirena) rimettono Bologna in carreggiata (56-56 al 30?). Amoroso apre l?ultimo periodo con 6 punti consecutivi, anticipando una lunga scarica di canestri dall?arco, da una parte e dall?altra: prima colpiscono Jaaber (nella foto Ap/LaPresse) e Hawkins, rispondono Winston e Koponen, ma ancora Jaaber e Mancinelli riportano Milano sul +6 (70-76). Il festival delle triple virtussine si spegne con l?ultima fiammata di Sanikidze, ma l?AJ resta fredda nel finale affidandosi a Hawkins: il Falco (19 punti, 8 rimbalzi e 7 assist) non sbaglia un colpo, e sarÃ poi Finley, con una bomba allo scadere dei 24", a griffare definitivamente il successo dell?Olimpia. Nel finale lo stillicidio dei tiri liberi non porta nulla in casa bolognese, e Milano puÃ² aumentare ancora la forbice sul +13, utilissima in ottica di doppio confronto. L?AJ (5/7 da tre nell?ultimo quarto e 11/22 di squadra) avrÃ anche 21 punti da un Mancinelli molto costante e 13 da Jaaber; Bologna, invece, 18 (ma con 8 perse) da Winston e 17 con 6 rimbalzi da Amoroso.
ANGELICO BIELLA-LOTTOMATICA ROMA 100-102
Forse qualcosa in casa Lottomatica comincia a girare. Le tre vittorie raccolte in settimana (a Teramo, contro Malaga in Eurolega e sul difficile parquet di Biella) hanno mostrato una Roma piÃ¹ sciolta, piÃ¹ coesa e grintosa, e piÃ¹ assennata nei momenti decisivi della partita, cosa che, invece, a Biella sembra ancora mancare, complice anche la giovane etÃ e relativa esperienza dei suoi principali interpreti offensivi che non si chiamino Matteo Soragna. L?equilibrio regna sovrano a lungo, con attacchi nettamente superiori a difese a tratti ampiamente rivedibili (ma se il ritmo alto Ã¨ una costante dell?Angelico, Boniciolli dovrÃ invece riguardare qualcosa nei suoi meccanismi difensivi): Biella chiude il primo quarto con tre punti di margine (30-27), completamente risucchiati dalla Lottomatica fino al 49-49 dell?intervallo lungo: Gigi Datome sembra immarcabile (giÃ 19 punti a referto, ma si fermerÃ lÃ¬), mentre, dall?altra parte, Suton non sbaglia un colpo (5/5 e 13 punti). Nel terzo periodo Washington (22) e Dasic (18 con 6 rimbalzi) sembrano poter lanciare l?allungo romano, ma Biella rientra con la costanza di Suton (20 punti e 11 rimbalzi alla fine) e l?eclettismo di Sosa (24 punti e 6 assist): l'Angelico rimette la testa avanti prima che Djedovic piazzi la tripla del nuovo pareggio (70-70) dopo 30?. Nel quarto periodo, selvaggio, Charlie Smith esplode due triple da "Ragno" vero che danno tanta inerzia alla Lottomatica, ma Soragna, ingaggiando un duello spettacolare contro l?ex-Udine, risponde colpo su colpo. Ma poi, ancora Smith, da sotto, e un piazzato di Gigli dalla distanza regalano a Roma due possessi di vantaggio al 38? (83-87): Biella forza e sbaglia, concedendo poi giri gratuiti in lunetta agli avversari: la Lottomatica si arrampica sul +7 (84-91) ma prima Soragna, poi Salyers, con due triple estemporanee, ricuciono ancora fino al -3 (90-93) nell?ultimo minuto. Una forzatura di Salyers e una banale palla persa di Sosa permettono alla Lottomatica di scappare ancora sul +8 dalla lunetta, con un po? di fortuna l?Angelico torna sul -3, ma Ã¨ poi Washington, ancora dalla striscia della caritÃ , a griffare definitivamente il successo a 2" dalla sirena. Sosa segnerÃ poi una tripla da metacampo allo scadere, utile, perÃ², soltanto per gli high-lights della settimana. Il dato? Roma, che arriva a questa partita come la squadra con la peggior percentuale da tre punti del campionato, chiude con 10/21 dall?arco e il 64% da due. BENNET CANTU?-ENEL BRINDISI 85-62
Kris Lang segna 8 dei suoi 21 punti (season-high) nel primo quarto, ma il risicatissimo vantaggio accumulato dall?Enel nei primi 10? sul parquet del Pianella (15-17) non Ã¨ difendibile da una squadra che si dimostra ancora troppo corta nelle rotazioni e troppo dipendente da pochi interpreti offensivi. Sospinta da Micov, CantÃ¹ allunga nella seconda metÃ del secondo periodo lucrando sulle scandalose percentuali dall?arco avversarie (3/21 di squadra alla fine), chiude all?intervallo sul +8 (45-37) ed, esauritasi l?ultima fiammata a inizio ripresa di Lang, assesta la spallata finale a cavallo fra terzo e quarto periodo con un parzialone di 14-0 dilatatosi poi su un devastante 34-6. Brindisi, frenata dai problemi di falli di TourÃ©, a lungo in panchina, e da un acciaccato Roberson presente soltanto per onor di firma, ha soltanto 10 punti da uno spento Diawara, drammaticamente calato nella ripresa, e 5 con 2/11 al tiro da un Bobby Dixon a tratti inguardabile. CantÃ¹, ancora priva di Markoishvili per il persistere del problema a un piede, festeggia i 20 punti di Tabu (nella foto AP/LaPresse), che esplode triple a ripetizione nel finale (12/25 di squadra per la Bennet), i 17 di un solidissimo Micov e i 13 di un Ortner fondamentale in uscita dalla panchina nel secondo tempo.
CIMBERIO VARESE-BANCATERCAS TERAMO 91-98
Colpaccio della Tercas: seconda vittoria in campionato su un parquet non certo facile come quello di Masnago e ultima posizione che si va ora a dividere con Brindisi. Teramo gioca un primo tempo con percentuali stellari (70% nelle conclusioni) e riesce a costuire un vantaggio di 11 punti all?intervallo lungo (41-52) con un Josh Davis infallibile (chiuderÃ con 21 punti e 7 rimbalzi). La squadra di Ramagli allunga fino al +17 (44-61 alla metÃ del terzo quarto), quando la Cimberio prova a rientrare, trascinata da Phil Goss (17 punti e 5 assist): Varese si riavvicina fino al 4 (67-71), ma Teramo tiene i nervi saldi, e con un ottimo Zoroski (26 punti con 8/10 al tiro) riesce a riprendere margine scappando via nel finale. Per Varese, che perde cosÃ¬ l?occasione per rimanere aggrappata a CantÃ¹ al terzo posto in classifica, non bastano i 25 punti di Slay e i 18 di Thomas, mentre Teramo sorride per i buoni impatti dei giovani Rullo (4 punti e 2 recuperi in 11?) e Polonara (8 punti, 3 rimbalzi, 3 assist e 2 stoppate in 16?). FABI SHOES MONTEGRANARO-PEPSI CASERTA 87-89 d.t.s.
Sharrod Ford ci teneva a festeggiare la sua presenza numero 100 in Serie A con una bella vittoria, ma nonostante la sua doppia-doppia da 18 punti e 14 rimbalzi (cui si aggiungono, tanto per gradire, anche 4 stoppate), Montegranaro cade sul parquet del PalaSavelli in overtime, concedendo alla risorta Pepsi il quarto successo nelle ultime 5 gare di campionato. Allan Ray (16 punti e 7 palle recuperate) e Fabio Di Bella (16 punti e 4 assist) si scambiano canestri nel finale dei regolamentari, ma Ã¨ un 1/2 dalla lunetta della guardia della Sutor a condannare la formazione di Pillastrini al prolungamento. Si procede ancora con equilibrio straordinario: Jones (14 punti e 5 rimbalzi) porta avanti Caserta di due punti (85-87) dalla lunetta, Cavaliero risponde griffando l?ennesima paritÃ , ma Ã¨ ancora lo stesso Jones che, con un 2/2 dalla lunetta, permette alla Pepsi di rimettere la testa avanti. Montegranaro tira per due volte con Cavaliero nell?ultima azione, senza perÃ² trovare il fondo della retina.
DINAMO SASSARI-BENETTON TREVISO 87-92
La Benetton prosegue nel suo strepitoso momento tra campionato e coppa centrando il nono successo nelle ultime dieci uscite: la squadra di Repesa passa al PalaSerradimigni gestendo la partita nei primi tre quarti e resistendo, nell?ultimo periodo, al disperato tentativo di rimonta di Sassari, giunta alla quinta sconfitta nelle ultime 6 gare. A lungo in doppia cifra di vantaggio giÃ nel primo quarto (chiuso sul 16-26), Treviso subisce il rientro della Dinamo, ma reagisce aggrappandosi alle spalle di Greg Brunner (13 punti e 15 rimbalzi), e alle giocate decisive di Peric, 20 punti con 3/6 da due e 3/5 dall?arco. In doppia cifra vanno anche Motiejunas e Devin Smith (16 a testa), dall?altra parte non bastano il solito generosissimo James White (23), i 18 di Diener e i 14 con 10 rimbalzi di Othello Hunter.
MONTEPASCHI SIENA-SCAVOLINI SIVIGLIA PESARO 104-61
Il parziale del terzo quarto dice 29-6, e la partita si decide lÃ¬: Pesaro rientra dagli spogliatoi dal -13 dell?intervallo lungo (49-36) ma, anzichÃ© mostrare gli occhi della tigre, si vede stritolata nella morsa senese. La Montepaschi forza 9 palle perse, tira con un ottimo 9/12, raccoglie 9 rimbalzi contro 1 e, con 11 punti di Bo McCalebb nel frangente, lancia una lunga passeggiata verso il fischio finale. La Scavolini, che chiude con 27 palle perse e solo 50 tiri tentati dal campo, ha 12 punti da Almond (tutti nel primo tempo), 11 da Diaz e 10 da Cinciarini; Siena, invece, al settimo successo di fila, ne ha 17 da McCalebb, 15 da Ress, 12 da Moss e 11 da Lavrinovic.
AIR AVELLINO-VANOLI BRAGA CREMONA 83-69 L?equilibrio del primo tempo (37-35 al 20?) si interrompe bruscamente per un parziale di 16-4 di sponda avellinese a inizio ripresa, con l?Air in grado di volare sul +13 all?ultimo intervallo (62-49). La squadra di Vitucci cala quarto periodo, Cremona si riavvicina (69-62), ma non riesce a perfezionare la rimonta, complici troppi errori al tiro nei momenti decisivi: sarÃ poi Green a sancire il successo, prima dell?ultimo allungo a babbo morto nel finale. Il playmaker biancoverde chiude con 22 punti e 7 assist, mentre Troutman aggiunge una doppia-doppia da 24 punti e 11 rimbalzi; Cremona, che tira 9/30 dall?arco, ha 16 punti da Drozdov e 15 da Rowland.

description.hltext_display: [$] Deerfield FD holds Christmas party
Sri Lanka health authorities to register pets
description.content:
* Dec 21, Colombo: Sri Lanka Health Ministry sources say the government has planned to register all pet animals to curb spread of diseases.
A pilot programme of registering the pets will commence from Sabaragamuwa Province, said the Provincial Health Services Director Kapila Kannangara.
After the completion of the pilot project in Sabaragamuwa Province, the registration of pet animals in Western Province would begin, an official of the Ministry of Health said.
The Ministry says the initiative aims to prevent the spread of numerous diseases via pets. Rabies is one of the major diseases spread by dogs. Recently, the health authorities warned of another deadly disease spread through urine of cats.
ColomboPage - Recent 10 Stories

description.hltext_display: travel to iran through iranian land borders with turkey, Iraq, armenia, pakistan, afghanistan and turkmenistan
description.content:
Travel to iran and find iranian land borders for crossing to iran
iran Borders between Armenia Turkey Turkmenistan Afghanistan Pakistan and Iraq in west, north, east and south, Iran share border on west with Iraq and Turkey, in North with Armenia, Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, and Caspian Sea, Iran Borders In east with Afghanistan and Pakistan, Iran borders on South with Mighty Persian Gulf and the Sea of Oman.
Iran has over a dozen international overland border crossings. These allow overland travelers Travel to Iran and enter to Iran by crossing the borders from Iraqi Kurdistan, from Turkey, from Armenia and Azerbaijan, from Turkmenistan and Afghanistan and from Pakistan. Tourists can Travel to Iran by air at Tehran, Tabriz, Mashad, Esfahan, Shiraz, Bandar abbas, Kish and Gheshm Island, as Iran's Internationals Airports.
Popular Border crossings for Travel to Iran for overland Travelers Border crossing between Iran and Turkey is the Bazargan 24 Hours Border crossing Â
Border between Iran and Armenia is Nour-dooz Land Border
Borders between Iran and Turkmenistan is Bajgiran and sarakhas Land Border
Border between Iran and Pakistan is Mirjaveh Land Border Border between Iran and Iraqi Kurdistan is Marivan Land Border while Mehran Land Border is for crossing to South of Iraq (the Arabic Part of Iraq)
Technicalities for Border Crossing to Iran, passport and Iran visa
If you Travel to Iran then you'll need to Apply Your Iran Visa in advance, none of below Land Borders for crossing to Iran issue the Iran visa, Iran has issues with Israel. If you're travelling on an Israeli passport you'll be turned away at the border (and you won't even get onto a flight coming into Iran). Similarly, having an Israeli stamp in your passport will see you turned away or put on the next flight out.
Land Borders crossing between Iran and Turkey, Iran Bazargan Border, Turkish DogubayazitÂ (agri) Border
This Border is awash with Travelers crossing the borders To/From Iran to Turkey. Buses are always ply to Tabriz even mid-nights, Also you can take taxi to Maku as the first town (15 K.M) after Bazargan Border and then browse your trip. Maku Bus station is fast and affordable and you Expect Buses to Tehran, Tabriz and Esfahan. Iran Visa Must Arrange in Advance.
Land Borders crossing between Iran and Armenia, Iran Noor duz Border, Armenia Agarak Land Border
The only Iran/Armenia land border at Nurduz/Agarak. On the Iranian Side take the Taxi to Jolfa, the first tiny town after the Border. From Jolfa Buses are regularly ply to Tabriz and suburbs.

description.hltext_display: Favre suffers concussion, future play undecided
description.content: 2010-12-21 01:27:00 Minneapolis, MN (Sports Network) - Minnesota Vikings quarterback Brett Favre left Monday's 40-14 loss against the Chicago Bears with a concussion. In the second quarter, Favre dropped back to pass and was wrapped up by Corey Wootton, who slammed Favre to the ground as the quarterback landed on his left shoulder. Staff came out to tend to Favre, who walked off the field under his own power before Minnesota punted the ball away. "It's one of the few times I kinda went blank there for a while, in my career," said Favre. "Just the way I was slung around on the turf, I wouldn't say it was necessarily the hit." Later in the post-game press conference, Favre was asked whether he'll play again. "You know, I don't know with this concussion. Based on the time and based on my decision making, I probably shouldn't tell you one way or the other right now." Coming into Monday, Favre was listed as out for the game, but his status was upgraded to questionable earlier in the day. He started the game one week after his streak of 297 consecutive starts came to an end. "I woke up this morning and sent (Minnesota head coach) Leslie (Frazier) a message that, crazy as it may sound, that I was considering playing," said Favre. "I didn't get a message back from him 'til this morning. It was, 'Hey, if we can work it out we'll work it out'." In addition to losing Favre, Minnesota was playing the game without star running back Adrian Peterson, who was out with ankle and knee injuries. Peterson, currently eighth in the NFL in rushing yards (1,149), had not missed a game since Week 12 of his 2007 rookie season.
